To earn income of her own to help her husband cover household expenses and her son’s schooling costs, Marjorie opened a beauty salon at home ten years ago where she does various jobs like hair coloring, haircuts, applying nail polish, among others.  She also sells clothes via catalog.  She works every day from 8am until 8pm and sometimes even later if her customers require her services.

She will use this loan to buy clothes, dyes, permanents and other cosmetics for her work.  She’s been in the communal bank four years and likes it because of the help and the benefits she gets from the bank.  Her dream is to own a spa.

loans.use: to buy clothes, dyes, permanents and other cosmetics.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 23 years old and is from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with two children ages two and three. 

Anecita helps her husband in their fishing business. They work hard to catch fish and sell their catch in the community to earn a living. She is asking for a loan of 5000 PHP to buy nylon, floaters and fish net.

She hopes that with a loan she can sustain her business and even make improvements. Her income provides food for her family. 

In the future, she hopes to send her children to school and expand her business for a better profit.

loans.use: to buy nylon, floaters and fish net

loans.name: Claude

texts.en:
Claude lives in Chardonnières where he works as a building technician and professor. His wife also work as secretary. They married and have two 2 children in school. He is interesting in becoming a retailer to promote EarthSpark products to help farmers so they do not continue to cut down trees, consume kerosene for lighting, and have more savings. He has bought clean energy products in the past but now wishes to join the EarthSpark team as a clean energy entrepreneur.  

He is looking for a loan to help him purchase EarthSpark products to sell in his locality. He is looking to purchase solar light bulbs, solar desk lamps and efficient stoves. With a Kiva loan, Claude will be set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills to launch his business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for a clean energy retail business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic materials and school uniforms

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.en: Apolinario is a 51-year-old fisherman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is a widower with six children, ages 10 to 24. He is the sole provider for his family. Apolinario has operated a fishing business for 40 years now, starting when he was just a boy. He is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing net. His income supports his children's education. He dreams of expanding his business to make it more profitable. In the future, he hopes to buy a new and bigger boat for better profits.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las divinas están en su ciclo uno del programa de comités, ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas, están con muchas expectativas de ir mejorando y creciendo. Son 16 mujeres muy trabajadoras y entusiastas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cynthia, tesorera del grupo, ella motiva a sus demás compañeras a trabajar en forma disciplinada para el logro de los objetivos, ya que con ellos podrán mejorar sus ingresos y niveles de vida. Ella tiene como actividad las ventas ya que tiene una despensa, en la que día a día y desde muy tempranas horas trabaja para poder tener los medios y ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Solicita  este crédito para la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser bebidas, comestibles, frutas, verduras y demás insumos para poder seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
The "Las Divinas" group is requesting its first loan with the communal bank. They are learning to work together. They have high expectations of improving and growing. The group is made up of 16 hard-working and enthusiastic women.

Cynthia is one of the members. She is the treasurer of the group. She motivates the other members to work in a disciplined manner in order to achieve their goals, since they can work together to improve their income and quality of life. She makes a living in sales with her small grocery store in which she works every day, beginning very early in the morning, in order to have the means to help her family.

She requests this loan to buy products for her grocery store, like drinks, food, fruit, vegetables, and other supplies so that she can continue to offer the things that her customers need.

loans.use: to buy drinks, food, fruit, vegetables, and other supplies to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efrain es estudiante de la carrera de administración de empresas, comenta que su meta principal es poder terminar sus estudios y ayudar económicamente a sus padres, ya que ellos son quienes lo han apoyado siempre.
Estudia para poder trabajar y ser un gran profesional que ayude a las demás personas que necesiten de sus conocimientos.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases de la universidad y también sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Efrain is a student who is earning a degree in Business Administration. He says that his main goal is to finish his studies so that he can help his parents financially since they have always supported him.

Efrain is pursuing his studies so that he can work and become a successful professional. This will enable him to help other people who are in need of his knowledge. Efrain is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the payment of his university classes and also the fees.

loans.use: to pay for his university classes and fees.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El grupo  Kuña Aty está en su 1° ciclo  del programa de comité, en donde todas están con muchas ganas de crecer, mejorar sus vidas y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 10 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Margarita quien está en un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir, con ingresos muy bajos, pero ella es consciente que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, irá mejorando su situación de pobreza. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una marca muy conocida, también se dedica a la venta de plásticos, y por medio de su trabajo y su lucha está saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia para darles todo lo que necesitan.
La Sra. Margarita con este crédito comprara nuevos insumos para su venta de productos de belleza, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y así ir mejorando su situación de pobreza.
texts.en:
The Kuña Aty group is in its first cycle of the committee program, where they all have are very eager to grow, improve their lives, and therefore be able to help their families. They are participating in the survey for the elimination of poverty, where 10 of them find themselves below the poverty line.

One of the members is Margarita, who is in the first level of poverty, that is, with a very low income, but she is conscious that through effort, continuous work, and the application of the vital behavior of a successful woman, she will improve her poverty situation. She makes a living selling beauty products from a very well-known brand. She also sells plastics, and through the means of her work and her struggle, she is coming out ahead and helping her family by giving them everything they need.

With this loan, Margarita will buy new supplies for her beauty products business, which will help her to set her business plan. This will help her to improve her income and therefore continue improving her poverty situation.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah  is married with three children who all go to school. She also takes care of additional family members, her mother and a cousin. She has run a business selling used clothes for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 1400000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She works at the market five days a week and sells on a retail basis only.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever-increasing prices of used clothes in Uganda. She is aspiring to sell on a wholesale basis only and to educate her children up to the university. Her family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is married and has three children. Her husband is seeking employment in a neighboring country.  As the unemployment rate in this region is very high, he had to leave his country to financially support his family. Armine has been involved in agriculture for many years, breeding cattle and cultivating barley and potatoes. 

Armine works hard to run their farm and sustain her children's living. Her son helps her very much with running the farm and gathering harvest. He sells the harvest locally and gathers income, which is vital for their family. 

Armine is requesting a loan, which she will use to improve her farming business. She needs to purchase fuel for covering cultivation costs, which is very important for having a good harvest next season. Armine hopes to have a big and profitable farm and ensure a better life for their children so her husband will be able to come back home and stay with his family.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for covering cultivation costs

loans.name: Beinvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida is 55 years old from Getafe, Bohol. She is married with four children ages 15 to 21. To support them, she sells eggs, sausage and water in her neighborhood for an income. She has been in business for two years now. She is asking for a loan of 8000 PHP to buy more eggs and chorizo and to pay for her water supply. She hopes that with the additional inventory, she can sell more and increase her profitability. 

In the future, she hopes to be successful in sending all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more eggs and chorizo and pay for her water supply

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a single mother of seven children, and four of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of a food stall, which she has owned and operated for five years.  She works from home, six days out of every week. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more bags of green fingerling bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes and tomatoes. She is aspiring to own a bigger food stall, and to start going to villages to buy foodstuffs for her business.

loans.use: to buy more bags of green fingerling bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: María Gricelda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Victoria se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Victoria en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 50 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, uno mayor de edad y el menor tiene 17 años y  estudian en universidad. El marido es comerciante. 

Doña María utiliza el crédito tanto para ella como para su esposo ya que ambos se dedican a sus negocios pero por separado, ella es la encargada del bar de una escuela de la localidad y él tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa en el cual vende ceviches, encebollados, pescado y hornado con chifles platos muy apetecidos por las personas de la localidad, ella vende bocadillos preparados por ella misma que son saludables y nutritivos así como también jugos de frutas muy ricos, ya que ella los hace deliciosos para el gusto de los más pequeños, ella tiene este negocio por más de 7 años y su marido mucho mas, así ellos salen delante de una manera honesta y honrada.

Este crédito lo va utilizar para comprar pescado,mariscos, carne de cerdo, frutas y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de  4 años y le gusta porque con los créditos han mejorado sus negocios. 

Su sueño es que su hijo sea profesional.
texts.en:
The “La Victoria” (Victory) communal bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Manta’s La Victoria neighborhood.  Manta is a city known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular year-round and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

María, 50, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has two children; one is an adult and the other is 17-years-old and both attend university.  Her husband’s a merchant.

María will use the loan for herself and for her husband since both of them run separate businesses.  She’s in charge of a snack bar at a local school and he has a small dining room at home where he sells seafood cocktails, seafood stew, fish and roasted pork with fried banana chips which are very popular local dishes.  She sells tasty, nutritious snacks she makes herself as well as very delicious fruit juices that she makes to please the little ones.  She’s been in this business for more than 7 years and her husband has been at it much longer.  This is how they get ahead in an honest, honorable way. 

The loan will be used to buy fish, seafood, pork, fruit and other food items needed to prepare the dishes.  She’s been in the communal bank for more than four years and likes it because the loans have improved their businesses.  Her dream is that her son becomes a professional.

loans.use: to buy fish, seafood, pork, fruit and other food items.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik is a farmer and lives with his wife who helps him with the farming activities. They live in the small village of Byurakn, in Shirak region. The couple breeds cattle and cultivates haricots and potatoes. As a result of their hard and tireless work, the family is now able to earn income to sustain their standard of living. 
As a hard-working farmer who dreams of developing his farm, Andranik has applied for this loan to purchase a drill for cultivation work. This will help him  with his harvest and will significantly improve his income.
Andranik dreams of having a big farm and to be able to improve his and his wife's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a drill for cultivation work

loans.name: Clifford

texts.en:
Clifford is 28 years old and from Talibon, Bohol. He is married and has operated a sari-sari store (variety store) for 10 years now. This is his very means of earning a living. He sells canned goods, milk, coffee, sugar, cooking oil and noodles. He is asking for a loan of 5000 PHP to buy seasonings, noodles, canned goods and toiletries.

In the future, he hopes to be able to continue expanding his business and make it more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy seasonings, noodles, canned goods and toiletries

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 44 years old, from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with five children, ages 11-22. She has been in the business of raising hogs and farming rice for 23 years now. 

Cristina is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to further sustain her main livelihood. She will use her loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides.

She dreams of seeing a productive rice field to meet the needs of her family. In the future, she would like to see her children successful in their studies.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for her rice field.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en:
Desideria is a 35-year-old woman from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with an eight-year-old daughter. Desideria has been engaged in fishing and rice farming for eight years now. She is asking for a loan to buy lead weights, fish net, nylon and fertilizer. 

She hopes to give her child a better future through education. And her income will be for school fees and family daily food consumption.

loans.use: to buy lead weights, fish net, nylon and fertilizer

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Aminata, from Moriba town Bo. She is married, with four children between the ages of 10 and 27 years.   

Aminata runs a palm oil business. She sells palm oil, nut oil, and beans. She has been running this business for eight years. She works at the business ten hours per day and seven days per week. Aminata says that the main challenge to her business is that, sometimes, her purchasing power is very low.

Aminata has requested a loan in order to purchase food items, including gallons of palm oil and gari. The extra income from this loan will allow her to feed her children and increase her business. 

In the future, she hopes to export her goods. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase food items, including gallons of palm oil and gari.

loans.name: Karanday Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Karanda'y Poty  está trabajando ya en su ciclo número 9°  del programa de comité. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde una persona se encuentra por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, pero ella se esfuerza de igual manera al máximo para superar eso.
Liliana es una de las integrantes, quien es una persona muy laboriosa y emprendedora, quien cuenta que elabora escobas de karanda'y (un tipo de madera) y lo sale a vender junto con su marido, quien es su mayor apoyo y que siempre esta con ella en las buenas y en las malas ayudándose ambos por ir mejorando.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la elaboración de las escobas, ya que necesita algunos insumos y quiere tenerlos para poder seguir con sus ventas, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called “Karanda’y Poty” is already working in its 9th cycle in the committee program.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey and one of them is below the poverty line, that is to say with very low income, but she strives just the same to the maximum in order to overcome this.

Liliana is one of the group members.  She’s a very hardworking, enterprising person who makes brooms out of karanda’y (a type of wood) that she goes out to sell alongside her husband who is her greatest support and always with her in good times and bad helping each other out to gradually improve.

She is asking for this loan to invest in the broom making since she needs some supplies and she wants to have them so that she can continue with her sales which will help her fulfill her business plan which in turn will help her increase her income.

loans.use: to buy broom-making supplies.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Virgen de Fatima está en su ciclo número 6 ellas hicieron la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y gracias al trabajo y empeño que todas ponen están saliendo adelante y superando su pobreza. Hoy tienen la difícil tarea de mantener esos ingresos por medio de su trabajo.
Una persona digna de destacar es la Sra. Fidelina, quien se dedica a la costura, ella es una mujer muy hábil en lo que hace, es por eso que ya tiene muy buena clientela y siempre tiene mucho trabajo y trata de cumplir siempre con sus clientes. Ella es una persona luchadora, que sabe que la única forma de salir adelante es por medio del trabajo y es por eso que se esfuerza.
Hoy pide de esta ayuda para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos, ya que así podrá seguir con su trabajo y dando a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan y cumplir con sus pedidos.
texts.en:
“Virgen de Fátima” is in cycle #6 and they took the poverty elimination survey.  Thanks to the work and effort they are all doing they are getting ahead and overcoming their poverty.  Today, they face the difficult task of maintaining their income by means of their work.

A person worth pointing out is Fidelina who works sewing.  She’s very skilled at what she does which is why she has a very good clientele; she always has much work and always tries to satisfy her customers.  She’s a tenacious woman who knows that the only way to get ahead is by means of work and that’s why she strives.

She’s asking for this help today to buy fabric and thread because she will thus be able to continue working and giving her customers everything they need and to fill all her orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Domino

texts.en:
Domino is 28 years old and from Talibon, Bohol. He is married and has been engaged in seaweed farming and a sari-sari store business for three years now. He works hard so he can have a good return on his investment. He is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy seaweed seedlings and plastic rope. His goal is to always be productive and to increase business profitability. 

In the future, he hopes to venture into other business opportunities for his family.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings and plastic rope

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Agatha, from Moriba Town, Bo. She is married and has two children, ages 20 and 23 years. Her children are attending school.

Agatha runs a pharmacy business; she sells, for example, malarial drugs, blood syrup and injections. She has been running this business for eight years. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that her business is doing well, because it enables her to help her community through medical care.

Agatha has requested a loan in order to purchase more medical drugs, to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, she hopes to open a big hospital. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more medical drugs to expand her pharmacy business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, vegetables, fruit, meat, etc.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El comité  San Juan, se conformó con la iniciativa de una de las integrantes. Actualmente se encuentran  en el 3er  ciclo, con catorce integrantes, son de la ciudad de Curuguaty, una ciudad bastante alejada de la capital, con escaso acceso a ciertas seguridades y que sigue luchando por crecer.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Elena, quien comenta que entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que  hace se dedica a las compras  y ventas de animales y lograr un mayor  ingreso dentro de su familia. Ella participa de las capacitaciones y así está luchando por mejorar en todo sentido en su vida.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra animales y también para la compras de prendas, calzados y demás para su macate (venta ambulante) que es algo que está emprendiendo, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The “San Juan” committee formed thanks to one of the member’s initiative.  They are currently in the 3rd cycle with 14 members.  They are from the city of Curuguaty, a city quite far from the capital, with scarce access to certain securities that continues striving to grow.

One of the members is Elena who comments that among the things she does is buying and selling animals to earn higher income for her family.  She participates in the training and is striving this way to improve her life in all ways.

She’s asking for this loan to buy animals and also to buy articles of clothing, shoes and others to sell from place to place which is something she’s just starting and that will help her fulfill her business plan which in turn will help her increase her income.

loans.use: to buy animals and clothes.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Emprendedoras es un trabajador grupo, que gracias a todas ya está en su sexto ciclo, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una de ellas y así seguir luchando por mejorar en los puntos que más ayuda necesitan por medio de las capacitaciones.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Virila, ella tiene una despensa en su casa, a través de esta actividad que ella realiza puede sostener económicamente a su familia. A través del esfuerzo y el sacrificio ella va ampliando su negocio, obteniendo más ganancias y a la vez contando con más clientes. Su sueño es poder seguir creciendo y el día de mañana que su pequeña despensa sea un gran autoservicio.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para compra de insumos de primera necesidad para su despensa, como ser harina, fideos, verduras, arroz y demás insumos, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
“Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) is a hardworking group; thanks to all their effort it’s now in its 6th cycle.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey to get to know each of their situations to continue striving to improve through training those points they most need.

One of the members is Virila.  She has a home-based store and by means of this activity is able to support her family economically.  By means of effort and sacrifice she’s been expanding her business earning more profits while gaining more customers at the same time.  Her dream is to be able to continue growing so that in future her small store will become a great self-serve.

She’s requesting this loan to buy basic staples like flour, noodles, vegetables, rice, etc. for her store that will help her fulfill her business plan which in turn will help her increase her income.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda es de la ciudad de Pilar, ella se dedica a hacer artículos de cotillón y servicios en eventos especiales ya sea cumpleaños, casamientos, bautismos 15 años y otros.
Ella está casada, tiene dos hijos, su marido es Policía con una antigüedad de más de 5 años y ambos se ayudan para poder darle a su familia lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones como las que ella tuvo que pasar.  Es una persona muy trabajadora, con más de 10 años de experiencia en su trabajo y es muy conocida.
Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para su cotillón, y artículos de decoración de eventos, ya que de esa forma seguirá dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nilda is from the city of Pilar. She makes a living making cotillion items and providing special event services, either for birthdays, weddings, baptisms, 15-year birthdays, and others.

She is married with two children. Her husband is a policeman with more than five years of service, and both of them help each other to be able to give their family what is needed to not have to go through any hardships like those she had to go through. She is a very hard-working person, with more than 10 years of experience in her work, and she is very well-known.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of various supplies for cotillion and decoration items for events, since in this way she will continue providing good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy various supplies for cotillion and decoration items.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El Sr. Oscar tiene 24 años, vive en casa propia con sus padres en la Ciudad de Paraguarí, es comerciante, y se dedica a la venta de cuadros y espejos en general.
Tiene  un trabajo muy sacrificado ya que se levanta casi todos los días a tempranas horas de la madrugada para empezar su jornada laboral, volviendo a su  casa casi al anochecer. Es un joven muy conocido por su sacrificio y ganas de trabajar que demuestra todos los días.
 Solicitó el préstamo para la compra de cuadros para la venta, como así también de espejos, que es el objeto principal de sus ventas. Agradece por esta oportunidad de progreso que está recibiendo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Oscar is 24 years old. He lives with his parents in the city of Paraguarí. He is a salesman, dedicated to the sale of paintings and mirrors.

He has a very demanding job that requires him to wake up almost every day in the early morning hours to begin his workday. He returns home around sunset. He is a very well-known young man due to his sacrifices and because he is eager to work every day.

He requests this loan to buy paintings to sell, as well as mirrors, since these are the main items that he sells. He is grateful for the opportunity that he has been given since it will help him a lot.

loans.use: to buy paintings and mirrors to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 50-year-old owner of a sari-sari (variety) store. She lives in Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has five children. Josephine relies on her business income to support her children, including paying for their school fees and food.

She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy additional stock for her store, including chips, canned goods, noodles, rice and seasonings, and also to pay the tuition for her children. 

She is determined to make the most out of her business. In the future, she hopes to make her store bigger and offer greater variety of merchandise to her customers.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her store and to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Enid

texts.en:
Enid is married with seven children, aged 18, 15, 12, 9, 7, 5 and 3 years respectively. She is involved in agriculture with her husband, and grows mainly bananas and coffee as a major source of income to meet the needs of her household.

Enid wants a loan of UGX 800,000 (eight hundred thousand shillings) to buy mulches for covering her banana plantation so that moisture can be maintained for a longer period. In this way, the yields can increase to keep supporting the family in terms of income generation. 

Enid’s dream is to acquire more land so that they can start practicing agriculture on a larger scale for more returns. However, she is always challenged by the changing weather as well as the price fluctuation for agricultural products on the market.

loans.use: to buy mulches for her banana plantation.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine runs a local soap business, and she sells charcoal at her house. She has been running this business for three years. She works at the business throughout the week and eight hours per day. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to run her business and price inflation.

Catherine has requested a loan in order to purchase palm oil and charcoal. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and roof her house to protect her residents from the rainy season. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and charcoal.

loans.name: Yatta

texts.en:
Yatta is 35 and married with three children between the ages of 10 years and 23 years. She runs a palm oil business in Yatta town Bo, in the Southern area of Sierra Leone.    

She started business after the war and sells palm oil and gari at a particular point in place.  She says that the main challenges to her business are transporting her goods and a very difficult and improper business location.

Yatta requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more bags of gari and palm oil for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to be responsible for feeding her family and have a permanent business location. In the future, she would like to open a local food store enterprise. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of gari and palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Linda Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, es una joven de 22 años de edad que desde hace varios años se ha dedicado a diversas actividades laborales, inició con un pequeño salón de belleza ubicado en el garaje de su casa, con el cual tuvo muy buen desempeño y logró adquirir recursos para aportar a la economía de su hogar hasta finales del año 2012 cuando lo cerró, porque quería incursionar en el área comercial y desde inicios de este año, comenzó nuevamente su negocio ofreciendo accesorios para celulares, con el cual ha tenido éxito durante los meses que lleva de funcionamiento. La titular se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, amable, con visión y muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por esta razón que se anima a solicitar su sexto ciclo de crédito, para invertirlo en mejoras locativas (pintar el local) y comprar mercancía (accesorios, protectores de pantalla, equipos de diversas gamas, entre otros) con el fin de darle una mejor imagen al negocio, que logre atraer más clientes para ofrecerles una variedad de productos que satisfagan las necesidades y gustos de todos los que visiten el negocio, de esta manera logrará obtener más ingresos para continuar aportando a la economía de su hogar y ahorrar para montar varias sucursales de su negocio y así tendrá un futuro más próspero, donde podrá mejorar notoriamente su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is a young woman of 22 who has worked at various activities for several years. She started with a small beauty salon located in the garage of her home, with which she had very good results. She managed to acquire resources for contributing to her household's finances, until the end of 2012 when she closed it, because she wanted to enter the sales field. In the early part of this year she again started a business, this one offering cell phone accessories, with which she has had success in the months it has been open. 

The owner is known for being an enterprising, friendly woman with vision and a great desire to succeed. It is for this reason that she is deciding to request her sixth loan, in order to invest in site improvements (painting the shop) and buying merchandise (accessories, screen protectors, assorted equipment, and other items), with the aim of giving her business a better appearance that will succeed in attracting more clients. This is so that she can offer them a variety of products to meet the needs and tastes of everyone who comes to her store. 

In this way she will succeed in obtaining more income so that she continue contributing to her household's finances and save so that she can set up several branches of her business. This way she will have a more prosperous future where she will be able to notably improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To make site improvements (painting the shop) and buy merchandise (accessories. screen protectors, assorted equipment, and other items).

loans.name: Badiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! In the photo is 35-year-old Badiatu, from Moriba Town, Bo. She is married and has five children between the ages of 9 and 14 years.  Her children are attending school. 

Badiatu runs a food business; she sells palm oil, nut oil and beans. She has been running this business for eight years. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. Badiatu says that the main challenges to her business are high competition in the palm oil business, and transportation problems.

Badiatu has requested a loan, which she will use to purchase food items, including gallons of palm oil and gari (a food product made from cassava). The extra income from this loan will allow her to feed her children and increase her business. In the future, she hope to export her goods. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase food items to resell, including gallons of palm oil and gari.

loans.name: Darius

texts.en:
At 27, Darius is the bread-winner for his family. He supports them with the profits he earns from his Zoona mobile money transfer business, located in Mazabuka town of Zambia.

Darius is taking out a Kiva loan, so that he can increase his working capital float, which will help him to grow his business because he will be able to serve a lot more customers wanting to send and receive money from his shop.  

Darius explained that Mazabuka is a fast-growing town and his business has grown from the time he started. The growth has meant that a lot of people now know his shop and he is failing to meet their demand to process money transfer transactions. This puts Darius under a lot of pressure in his day-to-day running of the business.  

Darius is grateful for the opportunity he has been given to grow his business with a Kiva loan. He says it helps him take care of himself and his family. Darius dreams of opening up more mobile money transfer outlets.

loans.use: to grow his Zoona money transfer business by increasing his working capital to serve more customers.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 30 years old, married, and has one child.  She is from Torkpoi town Bo in Sierra Leone.  In 2007, Kadiatu established her egg business. She began her business because she needed to generate income to take care of herself and her family. She works every day from morning to night.  The main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation.

Kadiatu is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase cartons of eggs and general stock. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay the loan. In the future, Kadaitu plans to see her business to a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of eggs and general stock.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 29-year-old Fatmata from Moriba town Bo in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children. One of her children is going to school.  In 2005, Fatmata established her palm oil business. She began her business because she needs to generate income to take care of herself and her family. She works at the business every day from morning to night.  She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase palm oil, gari and general stock. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, she plans to see her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, gari and general stock.

loans.name: Alas De Paloma Group

texts.es: Socias formadas por cuatro socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Angela tiene 31 años de edad, casada, con tres hijos de 10,09 y 05 años respectivamente, su negocio es la venta de frutas y refrescos naturales, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a eso, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de  frutas naturales como bananos, sandía, melón, granadillas, piñas, azúcar, rodaminas, naranjas dulces etc. Blanca tiene 64 años su negocio es la venta de leñas, carbón etc., María tiene 24 años su negocio es la venta de ropa usada, Aura tiene 44 años su negocio es la venta de prendas de plata, fritanga, zapatos usados etc.
texts.en:
This group is made up of four enterprising women. One of them is Angela who is 31 years old, married and with three children aged 10, 9 and 5 years old respectively. Her business is the sale of fruits and natural drinks and she has been doing this for a living for the past 4 years. She will invest this loan in the purchase of natural fruits like banana, watermelon, melon, passion fruit, pineapple, sugar, rhodamine dye, sweet oranges, etc.

Blanca is 64 years old and her business is the sale of firewood, charcoal, etc. María is 24 years old and her business is the sale of second hand clothing. Aura is 44 years old and her business is the sale of silver jewelry, fried food, second hand shoes, etc.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fruits such as banana, watermelon, melon, passion fruit, pineapple, sugar, rhodamine dye, sweet oranges, etc.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramon es comerciante, se dedica a la compra y venta de producto de limpieza, es distribuidor exclusivo en la zona, está casado tiene dos hijos. También el señor es ganadero tiene un campo con animales vacunos.
 Es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se dedica hace mas de 5 años a su trabajo, ya tiene muy buena clientela y con ello está ayudando a su familia dándoles todo lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones como las que él tuvo que pasar.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos de limpieza y balanceados para sus animales, con lo que podrá seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Ramon is a businessman and works buying and selling cleaning products. He is an exclusive distributor in the area. He is married and has two children. 

As well, he raises livestock and has a pasture with cattle. He is a very hard-working person who has devoted himself to his work for more than five years. He already has a good clientele and with this is helping his family, giving them everything they need so that they don't have to experience any kind of hardship such as those he had to experience. 

He is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the purchase of cleaning supplies and balanced animal feed. With these he will be able to continue with his work as he has been doing.

loans.use: To buy cleaning supplies and balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Kwaku

texts.en:
Kwaku is an artisan who specializes in traditional African masks and wood carvings. He would like to purchase wood, paints, metal plates, beads and polish.

Kwaku has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I studied business and worked for many years in the field, but I wasn't satisfied. In 1984, I was introduced to the carving profession by my cousin, who was a carver and also a professional teacher. For about a year he taught me how to carve, which seemed to come naturally to me. I then started a full-time professional carving career late in 1985. I have been carving on my own ever since. I also learned how to decorate my works with brass and beads, making them unique."

"I thank you for your continued support through this microcredit. I am grateful for your assistance, for it encourages me to continue carving."

Use the link below to view Kwaku's African masks and wood carvings on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/2392

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials for his masks and carvings.

loans.name: Luis Augusto

texts.en:
Luis Augusto is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in handcrafted ceramic ornaments. He would like to invest in paints and lacquer for production, as well as in cotton pouches for the ornament sets.

Luis Augusto has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"When I was young, I visited a ceramic workshop near my house. I was highly interested in this craft and started going to the workshop during my free time. Everything was so exciting to me that I learned easily. Eventually I opened my own workshop, where I was able bring in others to assist me. But the economy took a downward slide, fewer tourists came to our town and, little by little, my income declined, too. Today, I mostly work alone, and sometimes my family lends a hand."

"I really appreciate this initiative -- it's not easy for us artisans to obtain credit. Your microcredit will make it possible to get the materials I need to craft more products to sell. Thank you very much for supporting artisans like me."

Use the link below to view Luis Augusto's ceramic ornaments on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8668

loans.use: to purchase paints and lacquer for his ceramic ornaments.

loans.name: Salmi

texts.es:
La Sra. Salmi tiene 45 años y hace mas de 10 años se dedica a la compra y ventas de verduras al por mayor, su marido el sr. Sivio es constructor hace mas de 20 años. El crédito retiró para refaccionar la parte de atrás de su casa porque quiere ir mejorando, ya que al llover entra  mucha agua y quiere comprar ladrillos, cementos y arena para que por medio de su trabajo su marido pueda ir mejorando la casa.
Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que está recibiendo, que le permitirá tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Salmi is 45 years old and has been buying and selling vegetables at wholesale for more than 10 years. Her husband Silvio has been a builder for more than 20 years. She took out the loan in order to repair the rear part of her home, because she wants to continue improving it little by little. When it rains, a lot of water gets in, and she wants to buy bricks, cement and sand so that by means of their work, her husband can gradually improve the house. 

She is thankful for this new opportunity she is receiving, which will allow her to have a decent home.

loans.use: To buy brick, cement and sand for repairing her home.

loans.name: Ranogul

texts.ru: Раногул живет далеко от города, в сельской местности, где природа прекрасная и мирный народ занимается земледелием и скотоводством. Раногул более 7 лет работает в детском садике. Она работает воспитательницей. Раногул любит свою работу и планирует работать в садике еще много лет. Ее муж учитель в средней школе и получает маленькую зарплату. Раногул и ее муж воспитывают 5 детей. Раногул уже много лет мечтает отремонтировать свой дом и чтобы ее дети выросли в красивом доме, как дети других соседей. Она не имеет денег для покупки строительных материалов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки цемент, древесина и т.п. для ремонта дома. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Ranogul lives far away from the city in the countryside, where nature is beautiful and peaceful people farm the land and raise livestock. Ranogul has taught kindergarten for more than seven years. She loves her job and intends to continue to work at the school for many years. Her husband is a high-school teacher and earns a small salary. Ranogul and her husband are raising five children. Ranogul has dreamed of repairing their house for many years, so that her children can grow up in a beautiful house like her other neighbors' children. She does not have the money to buy building materials and has asked for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy cement, wood, and other materials necessary for the renovation. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair her house

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 31-year-old Musu, from Tokpoi town Bo. She is married with two children, ages 4 and 8 years. One of her children is currently attending school. 

Musu runs a food stand. She sells rice, flour, and cooking seasoning. She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business throughout the week and ten hours per day. Musu says that, sometimes, business is very difficult.

Musu has requested a loan in order to purchase cooking seasoning, rice, and oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her child's school fees and to increase her business. In the future, she plans to further expand her enterprise. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cooking seasoning, rice, and oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start up a rabbit-rearing venture to support their vegetable business

loans.name: Emelina

texts.es: Emelina de 35 años de edad se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace varios años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia,  vende de lunes a domingos y la demanda es más los fines de semana ya que la mayoría de tortillerías están cerradas, tiene mucha clientela por ser una persona amable a la hora de vender, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, Emelina esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal, para poder seguir con su negocio y darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Emelina, age 35, has been making and selling tortillas for several years.  Her business is located at her home.  She sells Mondays through Sundays, and the demand is greater on the week-ends because most of the tortilla shops are closed.  She has a lot of clientele because she is very amiable when she is selling.  She manages to pay some of the household expenses with the earnings that she gets.  She lives in her own house with her husband and their three children.

Emelina is requesting a loan to buy corn wholesale and lime powder.  She will do this in order to be able to continue with her business and to give her family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale and lime powder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, and herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica a la agricultura desde hace algunos años su principal siembra es el maíz y maicillo, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, tiene mucha clientela porque sus productos son de muy buena calidad y a precios accesibles, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y la ayuda de su compañero de vida logra solventar algunos gatos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su compañero de vida, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar su terreno para poder seguir con su siembra ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The client has been farming for several years, and her main crops are corn and sorghum. She sells her crops in the area surrounding where she lives. She has a large number of customers because her products are of good quality and affordable. With the earnings she gets from her sales and with the help of her life partner, she is able to pay off some household expenses. 

She lives in her own home with her two children and her life partner. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, herbicides, etc. and improve her land. This is so that she can continue with her farming, as that is her only source of work, and be able to give her family a better quality of life without any limitation.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, herbicides, etc. and improve her land.

loans.name: Fredy Alberto

texts.es: Fredy, a sus 40 años de edad, es separado y está a cargo de sus 3 hijos, luego de que su pareja lo abandonara. Hace varios años se dedica a la venta de mercancía (ropa, calzado, herramientas), actividad que conoció gracias a un amigo que se iba de viaje y le dejó la mayoría de los clientes que atendía, además de vender en la ciudad,  también se traslada hacia los pueblos cercanos, de esta manera ha logrado conseguir recursos para sacar a sus hijos adelante. Fredy es un hombre juicioso, emprendedor, con visión y muchas ganas de salir adelante, trabaja largas jornadas sin descansar ningún día de la semana, todo para seguir buscando oportunidades de progresar, por ello se motiva a solicitar el préstamo, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (blusas, jeans, tenis, zapatos, accesorios) para darle continuidad a su negocio y tener disponibilidad de productos cuando el cliente lo requiera, de esta forma obtendrá mejores utilidades por las ventas y avanzará para cumplir el sueño de fortalecer su negocio para generar oportunidades de empleo a otras personas, darle a sus hijos una vivienda digna y una excelente educación que finalmente se convierta en mejor calidad de vida para todos.
texts.en:
Fredy, 40, is separated and in charge of his three children since his partner abandoned him.  He’s been selling merchandise (clothes, shoes, tools) for several years, an activity he learned thanks to a friend who would leave on trips leaving him most of his customers to serve.  He also sells in the city and in nearby towns thus earning resources needed to move his children forward.

Fredy’s a sensible, enterprising, forward-looking man who very much wants to get ahead.  He works long days with no days off in the week in order to find ways of making progress.  Because of this, he’s motivated to request the loan in order to buy merchandise at wholesale (blouses, jeans, tennis shoes, shoes, and accessories) to give his business continuity and to have products on-hand for when the customer requires them.  In this way he will earn higher sales profits and will advance towards his dream of strengthening his business in order to generate employment opportunities for other, to give his children a proper home and an excellent education that will in the end translate to better quality of life for all of them.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Nubia

texts.es: Nubia, a sus 48 años de edad es una mujer separada y madre de 3 hijos. Por diversas razones, ella dejó su ciudad natal y junto con sus hijos llegó a un municipio de la región antioqueña en busca de nuevas oportunidades; se radicó y con unos ahorros montó un negocio donde ofrece el servicio de internet, video juegos y venta de minutos, pues aprovechó su experiencia como comerciante y con la ayuda de uno de sus hijos pudo aprender sobre sistemas, de esta forma complementa sus ingresos con la prestación del servicio de mantenimiento de computadores, que realiza eventualmente cuando sus clientes lo solicitan. Nubia logró sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos, sola, luchando día a día para ofrecerles una vida digna, haciéndole frente a los obstáculos que se le presentan. Actualmente solicita un crédito con el fin de invertirlo en el montaje de 2 módulos para video juegos, por lo que requiere comprar 2 televisores y 2 play station III, con el fin de satisfacer la demanda que se le presenta entre los niños y jóvenes del sector donde reside, quienes son sus principales clientes. Así logrará aumentar sus ventas y los ingresos para continuar aportando a la economía de su hogar y avanzar un paso hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño, que es ampliar su negocio brindando comodidad a sus clientes para que se diviertan e interactuen y diversificar los servicios que presta, para satisfacer los requerimientos de los habitantes del sector, esto le dará la oportunidad de tener una estabilidad económica favorable para darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nubia, 48, is separated and has three children. For various reasons, she left her home city and moved to a municipality in the region of Antioquia with her children in search of new opportunities. She put down roots and used her savings to start up a business offering internet services, video games, and the sale of minutes. She took advantage of her experience as a businesswoman, and with the help of one of her children, she was able to learn about computer systems. She now complements her income with the service of computer maintenance when her clients ask for it. Nubia was able to provide for her three children by herself, fighting every day to offer them a decent life and facing any challenges which came up. 

She is applying for a loan to invest in the installation of two video game modules, for which she needs to buy two televisions and two PlayStation 3s. Her goal is to satisfy the demand of children and young people in her area, who are her main clients. She will then be able to increase her sales and her income so that she can continue contributing to her home economy. She will also take a step towards accomplishing her main dream, which is to expand her business by accommodating her clients so that they can have fun and interact, diversifying the services which she offers in order to satisfy the needs of her area's inhabitants. This will give her the opportunity to have good financial stability so that she can give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to install two video game modules, for which she needs to buy two televisions and two PlayStation 3s.

loans.name: Andrés Felipe

texts.es: Andrés con 25 años de edad, es un hombre soltero y vive con sus padres. Desde los 15 años conoció la actividad de la carnicería, pues su padre toda la vida ha sido carnicero y fue quien le enseñó la labor. Hace 2 años, con el apoyo de una hermana, él montó una chatarrería, la cual había dado muy buenos resultados, pero por diversas cuestiones, el dueño del local, les terminó el contrato, dando como resultado el cierre de este negocio. Andrés es un hombre luchador, juicioso y pujante, por esta razón, hace aproximadamente 5 meses, tomó en sub arriendo una carnicería que iban a cerrar, la cual está ubicada dentro de un minimercado del barrio donde reside, pero él no dejó pasar la oportunidad, pues ese negocio ya tenía el reconocimiento de los clientes que visitaban el mercado. Actualmente, Andrés solicita su primer crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (una balanza electrónica) y surtido de carne al por mayor (res y cerdo) para mejorar la prestación del servicio y aprovechar el buen precio que le ofrecen por la compra de carne al por mayor, así podrá aumentar sus ganancias y tendrá la oportunidad de ir avanzando para cumplir el sueño de montar su carnicería en un local propio, más amplio y así ofrecer un excelente servicio ágil y oportuno, lo que le permitirá incrementar su clientela y mejorar los ingresos para tener un futuro próspero y una mejor calidad de vida en su hogar.
texts.en:
Andrés, 25 years old, is a single man and lives with his parents. He has been involved in butchering activities since he was 15 years old, because his father has been a butcher all his life and taught Andrés the trade. Two years ago, with the support of a sister, he started a scrap yard, with which he did very well, but for various reasons the owner of the premises terminated their contract and the business was closed.
Andrés is a determined, sensible, and energetic man; for this reason, about 5 months ago he sublet a butcher shop that was going to close; it is located in a minimarket in the neighborhood where he lives. He was not going to give up this opportunity, since the business was already well known by the customers who visited the market. 
Currently, Andrés is requesting his first loan with the goal of using it to buy fixed assets (an electronic scale) and meat at wholesale (beef and pork) to improve his services and to take advantage of the good price he is being offered for the purchase of wholesale meat. In this way he will be able to increase his profits and have the opportunity to work toward fulfilling his dream of establishing his butcher shop in a larger retail space of his own. Thus he would be able to offer excellent service, flexible and convenient, which would allow him to increase his clientele and improve his income in order to have a prosperous future and a better quality of life in his home.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets (an electronic scale) and meat at wholesale (beef and pork)

loans.name: José Eduaimer

texts.es: José, con 31 años de edad vive en unión libre con su pareja y es padre de un hijo de 2 años. Actualmente se dedica a la actividad comercial, pues tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde ofrece diversos productos de la canasta familiar, la inició hace varios meses y cuenta con el apoyo y colaboración de su madre, quien se encarga de administrarla. El cliente es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su familia y a su labor. Se motiva para solicitar su segundo ciclo de crédito, pues desea invertirlo en la compra de surtido (granos, arroz, aceites, mecato, productos de aseo para el hogar) con el fin de ampliar su portafolio de productos y tener disponibilidad suficiente para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes; con esto adquiere ingresos suficientes para velar por el sustento diario de su familia y  su madre. José sueña con posicionar su negocio para ampliarlo a corto plazo, así podrá recibir mayores ingresos por ventas y tendrá la oportunidad de brindarle a su familia un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida, y una excelente educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
José, 31, is in a common law relationship with his spouse and father of a two-year-old son.  He currently works in commerce since he has a grocery store where he sells various basic family staple items.  

He started it several months ago and his mother helps him and collaborates with him; she manages it.  He’s an enterprising man who is dedicated to his work and family.  

He’s motivated to take out his second loan cycle because he wants to buy stock (grains, rice, oil, packaged snacks and home cleaning supplies) to expand his variety of products and have enough on-hand to meet customer demand.  With this he’ll earn income sufficient to provide daily sustenance for his family and his mother.  

José dreams with positioning his business in such a way to expand it the short run to earn higher sales income and to be able to provide his family with better well-being and quality of life and an excellent education for his son.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 20 años a la venta de sandalias lo hace de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia  tiene mucha clientela pues su producto es de muy buena calidad a buen precio con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, santos está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería por mayor y poder seguir con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo para darle a su hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos is 53 years old. She lives in her own home with her three children. For the past 20 years, she has made a living by selling sandals. She does this on foot, walking to different markets close to her house. 

She has many customers since her products are high-quality and reasonably priced. With the money that she earns, she has been able to pay some household expenses.

Santos requests this loan so that she can buy more merchandise in bulk and continue her sales, since this is her only job and the only way to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more sandals in bulk.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 61 years old. He has six children and seven grandchildren. He lives in his hometown of Kazungula where he has been running his Zoona mobile money transfer business for four years. 

This is Alfred’s second Kiva loan. When he got his first loan, Alfred was able increase his working capital float. He also hired two employees to help him run the day-to-day business.

Today, Alfred is taking out another loan, so that he can grow his business by opening his second Zoona mobile money transfer outlet in Kazungula town. Alfred says there is a new school being opened and he plans to open his new Zoona money transfer outlet close to the district council. This will serve the teachers and pupils wanting to send and receive money. 

Alfred will use the money to purchase a new phone to help him make transactions and use the rest of the money as working capital float for his new outlet. He is hopeful that the new loan will help him earn more profits, so that he can continue to take care of his family. 

Alfred thanks the Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to grow his business.

In this picture, Alfred sits with his two employees, Esther, on his left, and Euphemia, on his right, whom he has employed straight out of high school.

loans.use: to grow his business by opening a second Zoona mobile money transfer outlet in Kazungula town.

loans.name: Silvia De Jesus

texts.es: Silvia de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus siete hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras sandias, tomates, rábanos, sandias, jocotes, chiles, hortalizas, entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio; Silvia es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor, desea realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor. Silvia  tiene buenas referencias de pago, esta agradecida con el apoyo y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Silvia, 42, lives in her own house with her husband and seven children.   She works selling fruit and vegetables: watermelons, tomatoes, radishes, mombin fruit, chilies, vegetables, etc.  She’s been in business several years and has gained much sales experience that makes it possible for her to earn the best profits.  The place where she sells is very strategic for the activity and very busy with passers-by.  She has a large clientele that prefers her because her products are fresh, well-priced and service is excellent.

Silvia’s an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work.  She wants to make a new investment but lacks enough capital to back her up which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy fruit and vegetables at wholesale.  Silvia has good payment references and is grateful for the support; she’s sure that she’ll be able to repay it while at the same time is confident that she’ll give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina de 63 años de edad, es viuda y  madre de 1 hija quien ya es mayor de edad e independiente. Vive sola en su casa construida a base de adobe . Desde muy joven se dedica a la venta de verduras en un puesto ubicado en el mercado de su localidad siendo a la vez una de las fundadoras de este mercado. Cuenta que se inició en esta labor ya que no contaba con un terreno para dedicarse a la agricultura como normalmente lo realizaban otros de sus familiares. Fue así que comprando verduras frescas que llegaban desde otras localidade empezó a establecerse y a mantener su hogar. Se siente muy a gusto con su trabajo ya que recibe la visita de sus clientes que son en su mayoría mujeres quienes diariamente ofrece verduras frescas como zanahorias, tomates, cebollas, limones y lechugas que tienen buena acogida en el mercado. A pesar de ser victima de la constante variación de precios por parte de los principales proveedores logra tener su negocio siempre bien abastecido siendo este el mejor modo de mantener su clientela. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente muy feliz por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de verduras al por mayor como lechugas, zanahorias, tomates, entre otros.
texts.en:
Sabina, 63, is a widow and mother of a daughter who is now an independent adult.  She lives alone in her adobe house.  Since very young she’s worked selling vegetables in a stand located in her local market; she’s one of the founding members of this market in fact.  

She relates that she started in this work because she did not own land to farm like the rest of her family normally did.  She started to buy fresh vegetables that came from other locations and started to establish herself and to support her home.  

She feels very good at work because her customers who for the most part are women visit her.  She sells fresh vegetables like carrots, tomatoes, onions, lemons and lettuce that are well-received in the marketplace.  Despite being the victim of constant price fluctuations from her main suppliers she manages to keep the shop well-stocked since this is the best way to retain her customers.

This is her 4th Kiva loan and she feels very happy for the financial support she gets to continue forward.  Also, she commits to make her payments punctually.  

On this occasion she wants to have 1,000 new soles to buy vegetables like lettuce, carrots, tomatoes and others at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Andres Alexand

texts.es: Andrés de 32 años de edad se dedica desde hace 10 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol cuando su cosecha esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía  para luego salir a comercializarlos en los mercados que están cerca de su colonias, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, Andrés está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, etc. para seguir con sus  cosechas y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Andrés is 32 years old and has spent the last 10 years working in agriculture, growing corn and beans. When the crops are harvested, he stores them in the granary shown in the photograph, and afterwards sells them in the markets close to his neighborhood. He uses this income to pay for some of his home expenses. He lives with his wife and two children.

Andrés is requesting a loan to be able to buy seeds, fertilizer, etc. for his crops, and to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 37-year-old Rugiatu, from Moriba town Bo. She is married, with four children between the ages of 7 and 18 years. Three of her children are currently attending school. 

Rugiatu runs a food stand. She sells rice, flour, and cooking seasoning. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business throughout the week and 12 hours per day. Rugiatu says that her business is doing well.

Rugiatu has requested a loan in order to purchase cooking seasoning, rice, and oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and to increase her business. 

In the future, she plans to further expand her enterprise. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cooking seasoning, rice, and oil for resale.

loans.name: Rosa De Los Angeles

texts.es: Rosa de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica  a la venta de ropa blusas, vestidos, faldas, pantalones, short, camisas,  etc. desde hace varios años vende de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela porque su mercadería es de muy  buena calidad y a precios accesibles, rosa está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor  ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rosa is 45 and lives in her own home with her husband and three children. She has for several years sold clothing in markets near her home: blouses, dresses, skirts, pants, shorts, shirts, etc. Rosa has many customers as she sells high-quality merchandise at reasonable prices. She is applying for a loan to purchase more wholesale clothing; this business is her only source of income, and the additional inventory will allow Rosa to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more wholesale clothing: blouses, dresses, skirts, pants, shorts, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 25-year-old Fatmata from Moriba town Bo. She is married with two children between the ages of 2 and 6 years old.

Fatmata runs a general stock business; she sells soft drinks, pure water, biscuits, and sweets. She has been running this business for nine years. She works at the business throughout the week and for ten hours per day. Fatmata says that, at present, her business is doing well.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to purchase soft drinks, pure water, biscuits, and sweets for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, pure water, biscuits, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es: José, tiene 37 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su conyugue con quien tiene un hijo,  vive en el municipio de Yoro. El  vivió varios años en el extranjero y hace dos años decidió establecer su propio negocio de venta de jugos naturales, ofrece Jugos de naranja, mora, tamarindo, sandia, melón y otras frutas. El negocio lo tiene en el mercado local y vende los jugos en vaso y en bolsa. El préstamo que José solicito es por la Cantidad de L.15, 000 el cual los invertirá en la construcción de una caseta rodante(troco) para la venta de su producto. Con esta inversión mejorara la apariencia a su negocio. Su meta es crecer con el negocio para mejorar su nivel de vida familiar.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old and is in a common law marriage. He lives with his partner, with whom he has one son. They live in the Yoro municipality. 

He lived outside of the country for several years and, two years ago, decided to open his own business selling natural juice. He offers many flavors of juice, including orange, raspberry, tamarind, watermelon, melon, and others. His business is located in the local market, and he sells juice in cups and bags.

José requests a loan of 15,000 lempiras, which he will invest in the construction of a push cart with which to sell his products. His goal is to grow his business and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to build a push cart with which to sell his products.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, él posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia desde hace 20 años tiene mucha clientela pues tiene la tienda bien surtida con las productos más necesarios como granos básicos, escobas, detergentes, jabón, golosinas, refrescos, sopas, etc. con las ganancias que obtiene cubre algunos gastos de su hogar, miguel esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas mercadería y surtir aun mas su tienda  para seguir obteniendo mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Miguel, 47, lives in his own house with his family.  He’s had a home-based store for 20 years and has a large clientele because the store is well-stocked with the most needed products like basic grains, brooms, detergent, snacks, soft-drinks, soups, etc.  He uses profits earned to cover some of his household expenses.  Miguel is asking for a loan to be able to buy more merchandise and better stock his store to continue earning higher profits and to give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta  vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, gelatinas, harina, golosinas, refrescos, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable, la clienta quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This client lives in her own house with her husband and son.  She owns a store where she sells basic staples: beans, milk, eggs, bread, gelatin, flour, snacks and soft-drinks, among others.  She’s been in business for several years and has gained sales experience that leads to the best profits.  It’s located at home in a very trafficked zone.  She’s gained many customers because she keeps the store well-stocked and people prefer her because she always has quality products at accessible prices and unequaled service.

She wants to increase business and make a new investment but needs capital which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy basic grains, snacks, eggs, bread, beverages, etc.  She’s sure that she’ll repay the loan and trusts that she’ll provide better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen de  43 años de edad , es madre soltera de 2 hijos con quienes vive en una casa alquilada. Carmen se dedica a la venta de repuestos y neumáticos para motos y bicicletas, lleva en esta actividad un promedio de 8 años y empezó usando los ahorros que tenía hasta entonces y con ayuda de sus familiares logro alquilar un local ubicado en una de las zonas mas concurridas de su localidad. Comenta que desde el inicio le fue bien ya que trata de mantener su negocio siempre con mercadería surtida y ofreciendo buenos precios. 
Gracias a la buena demanda puede también contratar los servicios de un ayudante a quien se encarga de colocar los repuestos en los vehículos de sus clientes. Se siente muy contenta con su negocio ya que el número de motocicletas que ve circulando a diario en su localidad va en aumento  y espera gracias a ellas tener buenas ventas. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para salir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para la compra de neumáticos para motos al por mayor esperando cubrir su la demanda de su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is 43 years old. She is the head of her household, has two children, and lives in a rented house. 

Carmen makes a living by selling replacement parts and tires for motorcycles and bicycles. She has been working in this business for about 8 years. She started it by using her savings and, with her family's help, she was able to rent a shop located in one of the busiest zones in the area. She states that it went well from the beginning since she always keeps her store stocked and offers good prices.

Thanks to the high demand, she was able to hire an assistant who installs the replacement parts on customers' vehicles. She is very satisfied with her business, since the number of motorcycles that she sees in the city is increasing. She hopes that, thanks to them, she can have good sales. 

This is her third loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she has received to move forward. She also promises to make her payments on time.

This time, she requests 3,000 nuevos soles to buy motorcycle tires in bulk, hoping to cover the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy tires for her business.

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
