El grupo llamado Divino Niño gracias a sus miembros ya están en el cuarto ciclo, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que luchan por ir mejorando sus vidas para poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan.
Prisciliana es una de ellas, quien está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder conocer su situación, estando ella en un nivel bueno, pero es consciente de que debe seguir trabajando para ir mejorando cada día más. Comenta que se dedica a la venta de comestibles que ella misma hace y en lo que le está yendo muy bien ya que es muy aceptada. Su sueño es poder tener algún día un salón y poder deleitar así a muchas personas con su trabajo.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra los ingredientes para la venta de sus comestibles lo cual le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Thanks to its members, the group called Divino Niño (Divine Child) is now in its fourth loan cycle. These women are heads of household fighting to improve their lives to be able to give their families everything they need.

Prisciliana is one of the women taking the Poverty Elimination Program survey to determine her situation. She is in a good place but aware that she should continue working in order to improve more each day. She says she works selling food that she makes herself. This is going well for her since it has been well-received. Her dream is to one day have her own shop and therefore be able to please many people with her work.

She is requesting this loan to purchase ingredients for her food sales, which will help her firm up her business plan and improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make food, such as vegetables, condiments and other items.

loans.name: Blanca Yesenia

texts.es: blanca vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo en casa propia, ella tiene un puesto de comida  en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Es una mujer luchadora que su empeño es dar lo mejor de si misma, para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Cuenta con la satisfacción de tener clientela fija ya que esta ubicado en un lugar muy transitado. blanca desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar lo dicho y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca lives with her two children and her husband in her own house.  She has a food stand in the market located near her place of residence.  She uses profits earned to cover her household expenses.  She’s a hardworking woman who gives her all so that her family will lack nothing needed for sustenance.  She has the satisfaction of having a regular clientele because she’s located in a very busy location.

Blanca wants to expand her stand, that is to buy tables, chairs and more raw materials like rice, chickens, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc. to vary her menu and earn a bit more economically but she does not have enough income for this investment which is why she approached INTEGRAL to request a loan to buy the above and earn higher profits to have better family economic stability.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and raw materials.

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.es: Eloisa se dedica al cultivo de maiz, frijol y maicillo de esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, es una mujer muy trabajadora, honrada  y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia, siempre está al pendiente de su familia ya que para ella es su principal fuente de inspiración y desea poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos. Ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a esta institución para solicitar este crédito ya que la temporada en la que se realiza la siembra, se aproxima, y quiere estar preparada con los principales insumos agrícolas como abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, etc. que es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
Eloisa works growing corn, beans and sorghum; this is how she earns a living and is able to provide daily bread at home.  She plants year after year and she’s a very hardworking, honest and responsible woman.  

Despite the conditions she lives in, which are very humble, she does not tire of working to give her family the best.  She’s always caring for them because they are her main source of inspiration and she wants to be able to improve their living conditions.  

She lives in her own house with her husband and children and has made the decision to approach this institution to request this loan because the planting season is approaching and she wants to be ready with the main agricultural supplies like manure, pesticide, seeds, etc. which is the reason for requesting this loan.   

She hopes to get favorable results since she has no other source of income. She trusts in God that she’ll obtain an abundant crop yield which will make it possible for her to continue providing daily bread at home.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Berta Luz

texts.es: Berta de 51 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace varios años, vive en casa propia con su familia, comercializa sus cultivos en los alrededores de la zona donde reside, tiene mucha clientela porque sus productos son de muy buena calidad y aprecios accesibles, con las ganancias que obtienen logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Berta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, herbicidas, fertilizantes, herramientas, etc. para seguir con sus siembras y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Berta is 51, lives with her family in her own home, and has grown corn and sorghum for several years. She sells her crops in regional markets and has many customers as she sells high-quality produce at reasonable prices. The income from her farm allows Berta to meet her household expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, herbicides, fertilizers, tools, etc. so she can continue planting and provide her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, herbicides, fertilizers, tools, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale vegetables, especially sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia lives in New Kru Town, which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are a bit difficult, due to the high rate of crime, fewer bathrooms,  filthy conditions, and over-population, but the most interesting part is that rooms are a bit cheaper, there are options for traveling, it contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia, and prices for food are lower.    

Forty-year-old Cecelia is married. Her husband works as a driver at his office and they both have four children, whose ages are between 22 and 10. Only two of her children are currently attending school and live at home. 

Cecelia was unfortunate not to attend school, but she was busy running her shop which sells charcoal in the market of New Kru Town. With the loan proceeds, she will buy more charcoal for her business. She said, "besides fewer goods on my table market, I have no other problem for now." 

Ten years ago, with a little money from her mother, she managed to establish this business and learned by seeing other businesswomen. She stated, "I enjoy the flow of customers and the fast buying."  Her dreams are to move from the charcoal business to a store business and to live a better life in the future.

loans.use: she will buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies (manure, fertilizer, pesticide, and fungicide).

loans.name: Varbah

texts.en:
Varbah is 30 years old, she lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Varbah is married, has completed the 12th grade and has six children aged between 23 and 13.  Only four are in school and live at home.  For the past four years Varbah been selling rice, drinks, oil, candy and others items in the local market.  She started this business with a small amount from her husband.  She learned this business from her mother.  She likes her business because the of the ways people respond to it.  She spends ten hours at her business six days a week.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, drinks, oil, candy etc. for her business.  She hopes to have more money in the future to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, drinks, oil and candy etc. for her business.

loans.name: Margrette

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 38-year-old Margrette from Moriba town, Bo. She is married with three children between the ages of 3 years and 15 years. Her three children are currently attending school. 

Margrette runs a retail business; she sells drinks and pure water. She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business throughout the week and 10 hours per day.  Margrette says that sometimes business is very difficult.

Margrette has requested a loan in order to purchase drinks and pure water for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children’s school fees and increase her business. 

In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase drinks and pure water for resale.

loans.name: Iye

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 47-year-old Iye from Moriba town, Bo, Southern area, in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of 8 years and 18 years. Her children are attending school. Her husband is a driver, so his income is not enough to take care of the home.

Iye runs a cookery business; she sells cooked rice, fried fish and cool drinks. She has been running this business for 15 years. She wake up 4:30 a.m. to prepare her cookery business, and she will not rest until the food is finished. One of her daughters usually helps her to run the cookery business. Her business is the only source of income she has. Iye describes her major hardship as sometimes it is very difficult to prepare the cooked food.  

Iye has requested a loan in order to purchase cooking items, including bags of rice, coconut oil and pure water. The extra income from this loan will allow her to change her cookery structure and pay her children’s school fees. 

In the future, she plans to have her own residence. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cooking items, including bags of rice, coconut oil and pure water.

loans.name: Rita De Jesus

texts.es: Rita de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, desde hace 5 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de gelatinas, flanes, bolis de sabores, charamuscas, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela ya que ese producto es muy vendible, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Rita esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar los ingredientes necesarios como frutas, colorantes, leche, gelatinas de sabores, también bolsitas y vasitos y asi seguir con su negocio que le genera buenas ganancias y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Rita is 54 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and her daughter. For the last 5 years she has been earning a living making and selling jellies, crème caramel, bolis [flavoured ice cream treats], charamuscas [frozen juice] etc. She runs her business from her home and has a lot of customers since her products are very saleable. With the profits she makes she is able to cover some of her household expenses.

Rita is asking for a loan so she can buy the necessary ingredients such as fruit, food colouring, milk and flavoured jellies as well as small bags and cups. In this way she can carry on with her business which gives her good profits and will be able give her family a better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fruit, food colouring, milk and flavoured jellies as well as small bags and cups.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es: Mary, a sus 30 años de edad es madre soltera de un hijo de 10 años. Desde el año 2008 se ha dedicado a atender su negocio, una tienda de abarrotes donde ofrece productos lácteos, cárnicos, galletería, mecato, entre otros, con lo cual ha logrado llevar el sustento a su hogar. Mary ha pasado por situaciones muy difíciles, debido a que fue víctima de la tragedia que se presentó en el sector donde reside por un deslizamiento de tierra provocado por las fuertes lluvias que se presentaban en el año 2010, ella perdió todo lo que con gran esfuerzo había construido, pero con su actitud positiva y su espíritu de superación ha logrado salir adelante al lado de su hijo y sus padres. Con mucho esfuerzo, esperanza y dedicación ella inició nuevamente su negocio y poco a poco ha ido recuperando el nivel de ventas que tenía antes de la tragedia, pues a causa de esto los habitantes del sector se vieron forzados a desplazarse y las ventas habían caído abruptamente en esa época. Actualmente Mary solicita el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (mecato, galletería, productos lácteos, entre otros) con el fin de aprovechar los descuentos que le ofrecen y así poder tener una mejor utilidad por las ventas, lo que le permitirá continuar llevando el sustento y la carga económica en su hogar, y así podrá avanzar un paso más hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es convertir su negocio en un minimercado, que sea reconocido y muy visitado por los clientes, así tendrá la posibilidad de brindar mejor bienestar a su familia y una excelente educación a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Mary, 30, is a single mother with one 10-year-old son. Since 2008, she has made a living with her own business, a grocery store where she sells dairy products, meat, cookies, and cakes, among other products. This has allowed her to provide for her household. 

Mary has gone through very difficult times, as she was a victim of a tragedy in her region in 2010 when a landslide brought on by strong rains took away everything she had worked so hard to build. However, with her positive attitude and her spirit to overcome, she has managed to move forward alongside her son and her parents. With plenty of effort, hope, and dedication, she started her business once again, and little by little she has been recuperating the level of sales which she had before the tragedy. Due to the landslide, the region's inhabitants were forced to move and sales fell abruptly during that time. 

Mary has applied for a loan to invest in the purchase of wholesale stock (cakes, cookies, dairy products, and others) to take advantage of discounts which have been offered to her. She will then be able to have a better profit when she makes sales, which will allow her to continue providing for her household. She will make one more step towards fulfilling her greatest dream, which is to convert her business into a well-known mini supermarket which is often visited by customers. She will then have the ability to provide her family with better well-being and to give her son an excellent education.

loans.use: to buy wholesale stock (cakes, cookies, and dairy products, among others).

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 49 years old, she lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 

Sarah is single, she did not go to school and has six children aged between 31 and 10 years old.  Only one of her children lives at home, and is in school.  For the past ten years she has been selling sweet-potatoes, yam, cassava, oranges etc. in the local market.  She started this business with a small amount from her fiancee, and she learned this business from her friends.  She likes her business because the of the ways people respond to it.  She is  requesting a loan to purchase more sweet-potatoes, yam, cassava, oranges etc for her business.  She hopes to have more money in the future to live better life.

loans.use: to purchase more sweet-potatoes, yam, cassava, oranges, etc for her business.

loans.name: Eva R.

texts.en:
Eva is 46 years old. She is married and she completed the 12th grade. She has 9 children between 26 and 16 years old; only two are in school. All of her children live at home. For the past 15 years Eva has been selling used clothes in the local market in order to help her children, 

She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Eva started this business by selling for her mother and she learned the business from her. Eva likes her business because of the way that people respond to it. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She hopes to have more money to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира, 44 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование-среднее, работает в местной почте-почтальоном. Супруг помогает по хозяйству. С 1998  года Замира занимается разведением скота, начав этот бизнес с 20 000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве имеет: 1 дойную корову и 3 теленка, а также имеет земельный надел в размере 1,50 ГА, на которой сажает капусту и помидоры. Ежемесячный доход от скотоводства и полеводства составляет 10 000 сом (KGS). Дополнительным доходом являются денежные переводы с России, там живет и работает старшая дочь Замиры. В целях увеличения поголовья скота Замира обратилась в  микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку коров, а также удобрений для обработки земли. На доходы от кредита Замира хочет также разводить скот и и заниматься полеводством.
texts.en: Zamira is 44 years old, married, and has four children. She has a high-school education and works in the local post-office. Her spouse helps around the house. Zamira has bred cattle since 1998 when she began her business with 20,000 som. The farm consists of one milk cow, three calves, and 1.5 hectares of land for planting cabbage and tomatoes. She earns 10,000 som per month from her livestock and crops. She receives additional income from her eldest daughter who lives and works in Russia. Zamira would like to own more livestock, so she asked the microfinance institution Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 80,000 som in order to buy cows and fertilizers. With the proceeds from the loan, Zamira wants to continue to raise cattle and grow crops.

loans.use: to buy cows and fertilizers

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is 45 years old, she lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.   

Helena and her fiancee who is a pastor, live together.  She stopped her education in the 7th grade and has six children aged between 28 and 7 years old. Only three of her children are in school and live at home.  For the past twenty years she been selling used clothes in the local market in order to help her children.  She started this business by selling for her mother and she learned this business from her.  She likes her business because of the ways people respond to it.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business.  She hopes to have more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 46-year-old Monica from Moriba ton Bo, in the southern area in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of 7 and 25 years old. Four of her children are attending school. 

Monica runs a cookery business; she sells cooked rice, fried fish, and cool drinks. She has been running this business for 20 years. She wakes up 4:30 am to prepare her cookery business and she will not rest until the food is finished. One of her daughters usually helps her run the cookery business. Her business is the only source of income she has. Monica's major hardship is that sometimes preparing the cookery is very difficult.  

Monica has requested a loan in order to purchase cooking item including bagged rice, coconut oil, soft drinks, and pure water.  The extra income from this loan will allow her to change her cookery structure and save money to buy a vehicle for her husband. In the future, she plans to have her own residence. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cooking items including bagged rice, coconut oil, soft drinks, and pure water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: "lily" Guillermina

texts.en:
Guillermina, “Lily”, has always dreamed of opening a retail location in her hometown of San Rafael. Lily’s passion for fashion led her to establish an online store for women’s clothing four years ago. She also sold at the farmers’ market, and the response was so positive that Lily was inspired to pursue her dream, opening a boutique in San Rafael just last year. Lilyluv Boutique is stocked with trendy, edgy clothing and accessories for young women and is committed to modest pricing, the only store of its kind in Marin County. 

The biggest challenge to opening Lilyluv Boutique was getting funded. Lily used all of her own savings to establish the business. When denied for a conventional bank loan, Lily felt that she was not taken seriously because she is a young woman. The discouragement did not hamper Lily; her determination to prove to herself that she could be successful, as well as a Kiva loan from Working Solutions, propelled her forward. She hopes her boutique inspires other young women to “follow their dreams, follow their passions” despite the odds against them. 

This loan will enable Lily to purchase the inventory she needs to grow the boutique and online store, purchase store furniture, and further promote her business. 

For more information on Lilyluv, visit the website at www.shoplilyluv.com, the Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/Lilyluvboutique?fref=ts, or on Instagram at http://instagram.com/lilyluvboutique.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and furniture and promote her business.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es: Eusebio tiene 42 años, es padre soltero de tres hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia construida a base de madera. Eusebio se dedica al tranporte por eso empezó alquilando un mototaxi para así ganar sus primeras monedas transportando pasajeros en la zona urbana de su localidad hasta que logró ahorrar dinero suficiente para comprar su propio vehículo. Considera que es un trabajo muy abnegado y a la vez entretenido ya que maneja  por las inmediaciones de la ciudad a pobladores y turistas con quienes entabla buenas conversaciones. Gracias a esta labor puede también pasar mas tiempo con sus hijos a quienes los lleva y devuelve del colegio diariamente. En mas de una ocasión su vehículo a sufrido desperfectos mecánicos quedándose varado en zonas alejadas de su localidad es por ello que trata de brindarle un mantenimiento preventivo a su vehículo constantemente. Tiene muchos objetivos a largo plazo y espera cumplirlos gracias a los trabajos que realiza como transportista, actualmente desea renovar su vehiculo para brindarle un mejor servicio a sus pasajeros. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles y junto a sus ahorros realizar la compra de un nuevo vehiculo moto taxi para seguir trabajando sin inconvenientes.
texts.en:
Eusebio is a 42-year-old single father of 3 children who lives with them in his own house which is constructed of wood. Eusebio works in transportation. He began by renting a “mototaxi” to earn his 1st money, transporting passengers in the urban zone from their locality until he gained sufficient money to buy his own vehicle. 

He considers this very selfless and, at times, entertaining work, as he drives residents and tourists around the outskirts of the city and enjoys good conversations with them. Thanks to this work, he can spend more time with his children, whom he takes to and from school daily.

On more than 1 occasion his vehicle has suffered mechanical defects, leaving him in zones away from his locality. For that reason, he tries constantly to carry out preventive maintenance on his vehicle. 

Eusebio has many long-range goals and he hopes to achieve them, thanks to his work in transportation. Now, he wishes to replace his vehicle in order to offer his passengers better service. 

This is Eusebio's 1st loan with Kiva and he is grateful for the financial help he will receive, allowing him to continue ahead. In addition, he promises to make his payments in a punctual manner. Eusebio wishes to borrow 1,000 new sols and, with that plus his own savings, he will purchase a new “mototaxi” vehicle in order to continue his work without inconveniences.

loans.use: purchase a new "mototaxi" vehicle.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine has become a devoted and responsible client, both for Nor Horizon and Kiva. She has taken loans from Nor Horizon ten times, and this one will be the second from Kiva. 

Karine lives in the city of Ijevan with her family: her husband, two daughters and a son. Her elder daughter is married and lives separately. Karine and her husband have had their own business for seventeen years already; it is trading of cereal. She mentions that it is a very profitable business, since in their city very few people are running it, and there is no serious competition between them. 

They sell a large variety of cereals in the central part of their city at a rented stall. They sell corn, barley, beech, groats, etc. The profit from this business has given them chances to organize their elder daughter’s marriage party and to pay the tuition fee of their second daughter. 

The first loan from Kiva helped Karine to buy a lot of products for her business, the result of which was a decent income for her family. This time, the aim is the same, and she also wants to pay the rent for the stall several months beforehand with the help of the loan.

loans.use: to buy wholesale cereal and fodder for reselling, and to pay the rent bills for the stall several months beforehand.

loans.name: Jaime Arcenio

texts.es:
JAIME tiene 29 años de edad es casado tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos y la esposa en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

La VRC LA PAULINA se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Recinto la Paulina, Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedican a Labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

JAIME se Dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, líquido mata plagas y una bomba para fumigar. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes.

Las compras y las ventas lo0 hace en la ciudad de Ventanas. El sueño es comprarce un lote de terrerno.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es reunir el dinero para comprarce un tractor para preparar el suelo.
En el tiempo libre le gusta dedicarce al deporte con los amigos del barrio.
texts.en:
Jaime is 29, married, and lives with his wife and three children in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos province.
The La Paulina Communal Bank is located in the Puerto Pechiche parish, in the La Paulina district, belonging to the Pueblo Viejo canton. The residents work in agriculture and livestock.
Jaime works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of urea, insecticides, liquid weedkiller, and a fumigator. With this loan, he will be able to buy fertilizer.
He makes his purchases and sales in the city of Ventanas. His dream is to buy a plot of land.
He has to confront the challenge of finding enough money to buy a tractor to prepare the land.
In his free time he enjoys playing sports with his friends in the neighbourhood.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticides, liquid weedkiller, and a fumigator.

loans.name: Patricia S.

texts.en:
Patricia S. lives in New Kru town, which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are a bit difficult due to the high rate of criminals, fewer bathrooms,  filthy conditions,  and overpopulation. But, the most interesting part, is that rooms are a bit cheaper, there is an option of traveling, it contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia,  and food rates are lower.    

29-year-old Patricia S. is married and her husband works as a businessman. They both have three children, between the ages of 3 and 11. Only two of her children are currently attending school and they all live at home. Patricia S. completed 12th grade before starting her business, five years ago. She received little money from her husband to establish this business. She is requesting a loan to buy more pepper, oil, beans, peanuts, etc. for her business. She said, "Besides fewer goods on my market table, I have no other problems for now." She learned from other businesswomen. She enjoys the flow of customers and the fast buying. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more pepper, oil, beans, peanuts, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cell phones, prepaid minutes, and stock (cakes, cookies, candy, and cigarettes).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase equipment to open a new snowball stand.

loans.name: Héctor Emilio

texts.es:
Héctor, con 64 años de edad, es padre de 3 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Hace 10 años se dedica a vender mecato, confitería, cigarrillos y gaseosas, inicialmente lo hacía en una chaza y ahora desde una pequeña caseta que consiguió, esta actividad la complementa realizando reparación de calzado, pues esta ha sido su fuente de ingresos aproximadamente durante 15 años, con esto ha logrado darles una educación a sus 3 hijos y ha construido su casa ladrillo a ladrillo. Actualmente se está viendo afectado por una situación bastante difícil, pues está a punto de ser desalojado de esa pequeña casa que ha construido con gran esfuerzo, ya que se encuentra ubicada en una zona de alto riesgo por deslizamiento de tierras; sin embargo, él se empeña en seguir trabajando en sus labores para continuar generando recursos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Héctor, motivado por 
su familia y por la necesidad de salir adelante, solicita el crédito que invertirá en la compra de un activo fijo (nevera) comprar surtido (mecato, gaseosas, cigarrillos, confitería) e insumos para la reparación de calzado (pegante, caucho, betún) con el fin de darle continuidad a sus negocios y  seguir luchando para que le adjudiquen una vivienda de interés social y así poder avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño, consolidar sus negocios, aumentar su clientela y así recibir más ingresos para poder darle una estabilidad económica a su familia y mejorar las condiciones de vida en su hogar.
texts.en:
Hector is 64 years old, the father of three children, and is in a civil union with his partner. Since 10 years back he works selling snacks, sweets, cigarettes, and soft drinks. Before, he used to carry his merchandise in a box, but now he has a small stall. Apart from this activity he also repairs shoes, this has been his source of income for approximately 15 years, and it has allowed him to offer his three children an education and to build his own house.

Currently, he finds himself in a rather difficult situation, because he is about to be dislodged from the small house that he has built with great effort, since it is located in an area where there is a high risk of landslide. Nevertheless, he is determined to continue working to generate resources for the sustenance of his household. 

Hector, motivated by his family and by the need to improve his situation, requests this loan in order to buy a refrigerator, supplies (snacks, soft drinks, cigarettes, sweets), and inputs for shoe repair (glue, rubber, shoe polish) so that he can continue his businesses and continue struggling to be granted social housing. In this way he will be able to progress toward his biggest dream, which is to consolidate his businesses, get more clients, and increase his incomes so that he can offer his family economic stability and improve the living conditions at home.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, supplies (snacks, soft drinks, cigarettes, sweets), and inputs for shoe repair (glue, rubber, shoe polish)

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark 31 has been running his business for four years now. This is his second Kiva loan. His first loan helped him to get his business started. Today, Mark is taking out a second Kiva loan so that he can increase working capital float and serve more customers.

Mark's business is helping customers send and receive money throughout Zambia. His business is highly dependent on how much working capital float he has, in order to process customer transactions.  Currently he does not have enough to help all of his customers and he is constantly having to re-balance between his electronic balances and cash balances. This is made even harder by the fact that there is only one bank in Mwandi village and it takes about 24 hours for him to get his money once he sends it to the bank. This means that he cannot serve as many customers as he would like to. He loses out on profit.

Mark is excited to continue to offer mobile money services to his community. He says the support from Kiva has helped his to start and grow his business and improve his quality of life. His daughter is now in grade eight at a good boarding school and he is able to pay school fees from his Zoona money transfer profits. He would like to thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To grow his Zoona business by increasing his working capital float so that he can serve more customers

loans.name: Usmonjon

texts.ru: Усмонджон 26-летний молодой человек, проживающий в городе Вахдат. Он женат и живет в доме родителей. Усмонджон энергичный и предприимчивый человек. Он собирается начать собственный бизнес по предоставлению услуги такси. У него уже есть опыт работы в данной сфере. Он в течение 3-х лет работал наемным водителем и хорошо знает все улицы и переулки города. Для реализации цели Усмонджону не хватает денежной суммы в размере 2700 долларов США и поэтому он запрашивает эту сумму в кредит. Усмонджон хочет купить машину и приступить к деятельности.
texts.en: Usmonjon is a 26 year-old young man, living in the city of Vahdat.  He is married and lives in his parents' home.  Usmonjon is an energetic and entrepreneurial person.  He plans to start his own business of providing taxi services.  He already has work experience in this area.  He worked as a driver for-hire for three years and knows all of the streets and alleys in the city well.  Usmonjon does not have the needed sum of 2700 US dollars to realize his goal and this is why he is requesting this amount as a loan.  Usmonjon wants to buy a car and start his business.

loans.use: to buy a car and start his own taxi business

loans.name: Vaililigi

texts.en:
Vaililigi is a 40-year-old single woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, yam and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Vaililigi has requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, a bushknife, a pickaxe, a wheelbarrow and chemicals. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Vaililigi hopes to renovate her house and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, a bushknife, a pickaxe, a wheelbarrow and chemicals.

loans.name: Muava

texts.en: Muava is a 75-year-old widow with eight children. She runs a small business selling chicken in her community, as she has been doing for more than 10 years. Muava has applied for a loan to buy chicken wire, fencing, nails, cement and timber. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Muava will save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy chicken wire, fencing, nails, cement and timber for her poultry business.

loans.name: Leuta

texts.en: Leuta is a 47-year-old woman who is married and has three children. She has a small plantation. Leuta is asking for a loan to help her pay her children's school fees. She will also use part of the loan to buy chemicals, barbed wire, a wheelbarrow and shovels. Leuta joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, barbed wire, a wheelbarrow and shovels and to pay school fees.

loans.name: Esolina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Esolina tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Además de cuidar a sus hijos se dedica a cultivar maíz, frijol y sorgo aprendió esta labor desde muy pequeña con su padre y sus hermanos ya en su familia Vivian muy pobremente y  su padre no alcanzaba para pagar a otras personas que le ayudaran, por eso eran sus hermanas y hermanos los que desde pequeños cultivan sus propios granos básicos para la alimentación de la familia y ahora ella cultiva en apoyo a su esposo. También, aprendió el oficio de hacer costuras y cuando tiene espacios libres se dedica a remendar o arreglar ropa ajena y de la familia. 
 
Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, tiene que viajar en pick-up o camión una distancia de 10 km para llegar hasta el lugar donde el cliente encuentra los productos que necesita.
 

El dinero  de este crédito será destinado para la compra de insumos agrícolas tales como 3 sacos de abono y otros productos como herbicidas para el control de malezas del cultivo y la preparación del terreno donde se sembrara frijol. 

Se estará apoyando al cliente a que pueda comprar los insumos agrícolas; ya que en este momento la milpa necesita del fertilizante para lograr obtener una mejor producción, y así tener la oportunidad de cultivar los granos básicos para el consumo de su familia. Y así podrá dedicarse a sus cultivos que es lo que desde muy pequeña realiza, y es una forma de generar ingresos a su familia.

El año pasado la producción fue mínima debido a que no se le puso  el suficiente abono a la milpa  pero con el  apoyo que hoy le brinda fundación campo, podrá sembrar sus granos básicos y fertilizar a tiempo obteniendo una mejor producción y el alimento de su familia como también un ingreso para cubrir sus necesidades y las de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Esolina is 32 years old, married and has 2 children. Besides looking after her children, she grows corn, beans, and sorghum. She learned this work from a young age with her father and her brothers, as in their family they were very poor and her father did not have enough to pay other people to help them. That is  why it was her brothers and sisters who from a very young age grew their own basic staples for feeding the family. Now she farms in support of her husband. 

As well, she learned the occupation of sewing, and when she has free time she mends or repairs other people's clothing and that of her family. In order to buy the agricultural supplies she has to travel by pick-up or truck a distance of 10 km to get to the place where she finds the products she needs. The money from this loan will be earmarked for the purchase of agricultural supplies, such as three sacks of fertilizers and other products such as herbicides for weed control, and for the preparation of the land where the beans will be planted. 

The client is being helped to buy agricultural supplies, as at this time her parcel of land needs fertilizer so that she can obtain better output, and this way have the chance to grow the basic staples for her family's use. This way she will be able to devote herself to her crops, which is what she has been doing from a very young age, and it is a way of generating income for her family. 

Last year output was minimal due to the fact that sufficient fertilizer was not applied to the parcel of land, but with the support that Fundación Campo is offering her now, she will be able to plant her basic staples and fertilize on time; obtaining better input and the ability to feed her family. She will also have income to cover her needs and those of her children.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies such as three sacks of manure and other products such as herbicides for weed control, and the preparation of the land where beans will be planted.

loans.name: Zoelu

texts.en: Zoelu is 24 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city speak Bassa, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. She is single. She completed the 12th grade, and she has two children, a three-month-old and a four-year-old. Only the older one is in school. They all live at home. For the past six years, she been selling food and drinks, including pepper, rice, oil and Vita (a fruit drink). She started this business with a small amount of money from her mother, from whom she learned the business. She likes her business because of the way people buy from her. She is applying for a loan to buy more foodstuffs, including pepper, rice, oil and Vita, for her business. She hopes to make more money and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs, including pepper, rice, oil, and Vita (a fruit drink) for her business.

loans.name: Tetee

texts.en: Tetee is 47 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city speak Bassa, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. She is married. She completed grade 12 before establishing her business three years ago. She started out selling for her mother, then started this business with a small amount of money from her mother, from whom she learned this business. She likes how people respond to her business, and she mostly enjoys the interactions with her customers. She spends eight hours with her business six days a week. She is applying for a loan to buy more red oil for her business. She hopes to get more money and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Tuugaita

texts.en: Tuugaita is a 40-year-old woman who is married and has five children. She has a small business, a taro and banana plantation. She is applying for this loan to help her make improvements to her house, so her family can have better living conditions. Tuugaita will use the loan to buy timber, cement, nails, iron roofing and roofing sheets. Tuugaita joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy timber, cement, nails, iron roofing and roofing sheets to make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Eteli

texts.en:
Eteli, a 53-year-old married mother of five, runs a small business making and selling faapapa or samoan bread and pancakes in her community. In business for three years, she has requested a loan to buy more flour, sugar, baking powder, a frying pan and dripping oil.

Eteli joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. She will use her earnings to save for her children's education and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, baking powder, a frying pan and dripping oil

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old and married with seven children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu, banana, yam and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years.

Maria needs a loan to buy barbed wire, a chain saw, chemicals and a pickaxe. She has been a member of SBPD since 2008. Maria will use the profits from her sales to support her family and to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, a chain saw, chemicals and a pickaxe.

loans.name: Tautala

texts.en:
Tautala is a 53-year-old married woman with 10 children. She runs a small business selling faapapa or samoan bread and pancakes in her community and has been doing this for many years. 

Tautala has requested a loan to buy a sack of sugar, flour, dripping oil, baking powder and a frying pan. 

She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tautala will save more money for her children's edcuation.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, flour, dripping oil, baking powder and a frying pan.

loans.name: Agasa

texts.en:
Agasa is a 49-year-old woman who is married with nine children. She has a small business of a taro and banana plantation.

Agasa is asking for a loan to help her pay for her children's school fees. She will also use part of the loan to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, fertilizer, an axe and a bush-knife.

Agasa joined SPBD in 2007 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, fertilizer, an axe, a bushknife and pay school fees.

loans.name: Afiafi

texts.en:
Afiafi is 29 years old and married with three children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Afiafi has requested a loan to buy a bag of flour, sugar, baking powder, dripping oil, tongs, a large spoon and a frying pan. 

She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings,Afiafi wants to support her family and save more money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, sugar, baking powder, dripping oil, tongs, a large spoon and a frying pan.

loans.name: Leatuolo

texts.en: Leatuolo is a 28-year-old woman who is married and has one child. She runs a business selling rice, chicken, sausage, toilet paper, sugar and other items in her community. She has two years of experience in this business. Leatuolo has applied for a loan to buy a sack of sugar, rice, tinned fish, noodles, toilet paper, lollies (candies), snacks, laundry soap, laundry powder, chicken, mutton flaps and dripping oil. She plans to use her profits to support her family and to save more money for her child's education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, rice, tinned fish, noodles, toilet paper, lollies (candies), snacks, laundry soap, laundry powder, chicken, mutton flaps and dripping oil for her store.

loans.name: Eminiana

texts.en:
Eminiana, a 31-year-old married mother of one, wants to start a small business planting taro and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, chain saw, digging stick, pick, axe, bush-knives and chemicals.

Eminiana joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services. In the future, she hopes to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, chain saw, digging stick, pick, axe, bushknives and chemicals

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнара, 49 лет, замужем, мать четверых детей (2 сына и 2 дочери). Супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. Гулнара занимается животноводством и полеводством с 2004 года, начав этот бизнес с суммы 20000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль 8000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день она смогла развить полеводческую деятельность, имеет в собственности земельный надел размером 2,80 ГА, на которой ежегодно выращивает: перец, кукурузу, капусту.  Также есть свое хозяйство: 2 дойные коровы, 2 теленка, и  250 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего  хозяйства и полеводства Гулнара обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50 000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят, а также удобрений. Доходы от кредита Гулнара планирует направить на увеличение поголовья скота и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Gulnara is 49 years old, married, and a mother to four children--two sons and two daughters.  Her spouse and children help her with her farm.  Gulnara has worked with livestock and in agriculture since 2004, having started her business with 20,000 KGS.  Her monthly profits are 8,000 KGS.  To date she has been able to expand her farming activities, she has her own plot of land (2.80 hectares) where she grows peppers, corn and cabbage.  She also has two dairy cows, two calves and 250 sheep.  With the goal of further developing her farming, Gulnara turned to the microfinance bank Bai Tushuma and Partners for a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy a calf and fertilizer.  She plans to use the income from the loan to increase her herd of cattle and improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Nukravi

texts.ru: Нукрави 44-летняя замужняя женщина. Она живет с мужем, сыном и дочерью в городе Вахдат. У нее среднее специальное образование. Она по специальности швея и в последние годы работала в ателье. Теперь Нукрави решила работать на себя и открыть собственный швейный бизнес у себя дома. Она уже отвела отдельную комнату для ведения деятельности. У Нукрави имеется стартовый капитал в размере 2300 TJS. Она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить компьютерную швейную машину. Нукрави будет шить в среднем по два платья в день: обычное платье и платье с вышивкой. По ее словам это очень прибыльный бизнес. Она за период работы в ателье приобрела своих постоянных клиентов, которые собираются и в дальнейшем обращаться только к ее услугам.
texts.en: Nukravi is a 44 years old and married.  She lives with her husband, son and daughter in Vahdat.  She has a high school diploma.  She is a seamstress by profession and in the last few years she's worked in a studio.  Now Nukravi has decided to work for herself and open her own sewing business out of her home.  She has already set aside a room for it.  Nukravi has start up capital of 2,300 TJS.  She is asking for a loan to buy a computerized sewing machine.  She will sew two dress a day, an ordinary dress and a dress with embroidery.  She says this is a very profitable business.  During her time working at the studio, she acquired a number of constant clients who plan on using only her services in the future.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine to open a sewing business.

loans.name: Sonia Jamileth

texts.es: Sonia, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, tiene cuatro  hijos y vive en el municipio de Yoro junto a su esposo e hijos. Ella es maestra de educación primaria y tiene más de 12 años de experiencia en corte y confección. Ha puesto su propio taller de costura en un local en el mercado y ha contratado empleados que le ayudan en  la producción. Elabora trajes de vestir, pantalones, chaquetas, camisas, blusas y otros. Ha decidido solicitar un segundo préstamo que es por 20,000 Lempiras con el que va comprar materia prima como las telas para la elaboración de trajes. su meta es lograr que su negocio sea auto sostenible y que sus hijos lo puedan administrar después.
texts.en:
Sonia is 38 years old, married, has four children and lives in the Yoro municipality with her husband and children. She is an elementary school teacher and has more than 12 years in the dressmaking business. She has set up her own sewing workshop at a stall in the market, hiring employees that help her produce clothes. She makes suits, pants, jackets, shirts, blouses and other garments.

She has decided to request a second loan for 20,000 lempiras with which she will buy raw materials, such as cloth, to make suits. Her goal is to make her business self-suistaining and that her children can manage it afterwards.

loans.use: To buy raw materials, such as cloth to make suits.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 40 years old and married with two children. She would like to start a small business, printing elei on puletasi, dresses and on t-shirts. 

In order to do this, Mila needs a loan to buy fabrics, an elei board, paints and brushes for her business. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, an elei board, paints and brushes.

loans.name: Tupe

texts.en: Tupe is 33 years old, married, and has one child. She has a small garden where she grows vegetables, such as cabbages, cucumbers, tomatoes and pumpkins, which she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Tupe needs a loan to buy a rake, a pick, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a spade, a garden hose and vegetable seeds. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. Tupe will use the profits from her sales to expand her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a rake, a pick, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a spade, a garden hose and vegetable seeds for her garden.

loans.name: Emau

texts.en: Emau is a 53-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Emau has applied for a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, a wheelbarrow, taro root, a shovel, a pickaxe and barbed wire. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Emau hopes to support her family and save more at the bank.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, a wheelbarrow, taro root, a shovel, a pickaxe and barbed wire for her farm.

loans.name: Isalei

texts.en:
Isalei is 33 years old and married with one child. She would like to start a small business, sewing different kind of clothes. 

In order to do this, Isalei needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, fabrics, threads and needles. She hopes to use her profits to maintain her business and to buy a new sewing machine. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabrics, threads and needles.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 44 years old and married with three children.

Araceli earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Araceli is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchse additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Araceli has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from buying and selling recycled materials, fishing and buying and selling coconut shells.

Araceli is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchse additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Embog

texts.en:
Embog works hard to support her family. Embog is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines.

Embog requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, flour, margarine, etc., for her business. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Embog would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, flour, margarine, etc., for her business

loans.name: Noel

texts.es: Noel de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cinco hijos, él se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y sorgo desde varios años, vende sus productos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Noel está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar  semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, y mejorar el terreno donde piensa hacer su siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía ya que esa es su única fuente de ingreso y así podrá darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Noel is 43 years old and lives in his home along with his wife and five children.  He is a farmer and raises basic grains and pays his household expenses with the profits from his sales.  He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, compost, fertilizer, and herbicide and to improve the land where he plants, which is shown in the photograph.  This is his only source of income and this way he will be able to provide his family with what they need without limitation.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: Mariano de 52 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frijol, vive en casa propia con su esposa  y sus 6 hijos, comercializa sus cosechas en los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, mariano esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. para tener buenas cosechas y asi el pueda obtener  mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
52-year-old Mariano works in agriculture growing corn and beans. He lives in his own house with his wife and their 6 children. He sells his harvests in the markets close to his home, and with the profits he earns he manages to cover a number of the household expenses. 

Mariano is applying for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, pest control e.t.c. so that he has good harvests, and so he can earn better profits to give his family more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, pest control e.t.c.

loans.name: Etevise

texts.en:
Etevise is 49 years old and married with four children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu and yam that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years.

Etevise needs a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, a chainsaw, bush-knives, a file and chemicals. 

She became a member of SBPD in 2013. Etevise will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, a chainsaw, bushknives, a file and chemicals.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 45 years old and married with three children.

Lourdes works hard to provide for her family. Lourdes runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, milk, noodles, eggs, etc.

Lourdes has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. Lourdes has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from the retailing of gasoline and rice.

Lourdes aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, milk, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. Gloria is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Gloria requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.  Gloria has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 43 years old and married, with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Clarita has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Clarita requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

Clarita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Clarita would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane lives in Tiaman, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental with her family. She is married with an only child. Her husband worked as a carpenter and she operates their own general store selling goods in their community. She has been six years in this business.

In 2010, she joined Gata Daku MPC and recently borrowed a loan to buy additional goods to offer like dried fish and bagoong (shrimp paste). She plans to expand her business and hopes to support her child's education in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to offer like dried fish and bagoong

loans.name: Ercilia Edis

texts.es:
Ercila tiene 56 años de edad. Es una persona que tiene varios años de dedicarse a la agricultura , oficio que aprendió de su abuelos. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Para ir al terreno en donde siembra durante el resto de la mañana y un hijo le ayuda; ya que él vive aparte y en la tarde se dedica a elaborar tortillas para vender.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos novillas para criarlas y cuidarlas para llegar  a producir leche.  Con la venta de la leche mejorara su negocio lo que le generara mejores ingreso para su sustento. Ella planea en un futuro poder construir su vivienda; ya que actualmente es de lamina.
texts.en:
Ercila is 56 years old. She has several years' experience working in agriculture, a profession she learnt from her grandparents.

She gets up at 5am to go to the field where she plants crops for the rest of the morning, and a son helps her because he lives separately, and in the afternoon she works making tortillas to sell.

The loan she is applying for from Fundación Campo is to buy two heifers to raise and look after to produce milk. With the sales of milk she will improve her business, which will generate better profits to support her. She plans to be able to build her house in the future, which currently is made of sheet metal.

loans.use: to buy two heifers to raise and look after to produce milk.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a beauty parlor business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional lotion, shampoo, hot oil, etc., for her beauty parlor business.

Ruth has been in this business for 6 years. Ruth earns more income from refrigeration and air conditioning services.

Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional lotion, shampoo, hot oil, etc., for her parlor

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice works hard to support her family. Alice is married and has a business selling spices and vegetables in the Philippines.

Alice requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy more spices and vegetables to sell.

Alice has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Alice would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more spices and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 37 years old and has three children, two in school. Annie works very hard to provide for them.

Annie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy grocery items sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, sugar and noodles.

Annie has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Annie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, sugar and noodles.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad works hard to support her family. Natividad is a widow and has a business selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines.

Natividad requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy additional dried coconut meat to sell.

Natividad has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Natividad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Isau Alexander

texts.es: Isau de 37 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus cinco hijos, es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son  maíz y frijol. Isau  desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
37-year-old Isau is a man who is very responsible with his household obligations, because he has always been characterised by offering his family the best. Currently he lives with his wife and five children. He is very hard-working and has always done his work with joy and enthusiasm. He works as a farmer and  every year plants the principal basic grains of the area - corn and beans. 

Isau wants to increase his sales and for this reason he visited the INTEGRAL offices to apply for a loan, which will allow him to buy: seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, among others. He wants to rely on the help he applied for since he does not have other monetary income, and in this way he will continue providing the daily bread for his family without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy: seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, among others.

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en:
Irenia is happily married and blessed with three children. She lives is Balintawak, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur.

To earn a living, Irenia manages her agricultural business, planting and harvesting flowers for sale. In their villages, most of the people are engaged in this line of business. This is the primary source of income for Irenia. She also has a plot of land planted as a vegetable garden to earn additional income.

She has been in this business for years. She has a monthly income of PHP 3,000. Irenia is in need of financial assistance for her flower farm. She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and to pay the weeding maintenance costs.

 Irenia plans that her business will be more productive so she can get a good return in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and pay the costs of weeding maintenance.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell, ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell through her buy-and-sell, ready-to-wear business.

Filomena has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Filomena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 44 years old and married with six children, two in school.

Elsie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling bananas and charcoal in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of bananas and charcoal to sell.

Elsie has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the banana and charcoal business for 12 years and also earns an income from selling coconut wine.

Elsie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of bananas and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio de 33 años de edad, vive con esposa y sus dos  hijos en casa propia, julio es un hombre  trabajador y responsable  desde hace 10 años se dedica a la  producción y venta de productos lácteos en la zona donde reside. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos, ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y concentrado para el ganado y ajustar para la compra de una vaca lechera que le permita crecer en el negocio. Con esto espera obtener resultados favorables y continuar brindando la ayuda económica a su hogar que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en:
Julio is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children in their own home. He is a hardworking and responsible man who has been producing and selling dairy products in the area where he lives for the past 10 years. Julio has a good clientele since has been able to earn the trust of his customers. He offers quality products at good prices.

Julio has decided to invest in the care of his cattle since he depends on them for his business. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in order to buy vitamins and concentrated feed for his cows. He will also set aside an amount for the purchase of a dairy cow so that he can grow his business. Julio hopes to achieve favorable results so that he can continue providing financially for the needs of his household.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, concentrated livestock feed, and another dairy cow.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from vegetable vending.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Julia to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, oil and salt. She has been involved in business activities since 2002. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Julia independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Her husband is a farmer. She is happy with the TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) programme that helps poor people to improve their living condition for the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, oil, and salt.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a 'buy and sell' charcoal business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional charcoal to sell for her business.

Letecia has been in this business for 24 years. She earns more income from fish vending.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy and sell charcoal

loans.name: Wendy

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Wendy works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Wendy is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials and equipment for her fishing/fish vending business.

Wendy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and equipment for her business

loans.name: Lama

texts.en:
Lama is 51 years old and married with 10 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for  three years. Lama needs a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, taro roots, a file, bush knives, water gallons and barbed wire. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. Lama will use the profits from her sales to renovate her house and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, taro roots, a file, bush knives, water gallons and barbed wire

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia is 58 and a widow who lives in Lintugop, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She dwells with one of her married children. To make a living, she weaves 'nipa' (a sort of palm) leaves selling the mats in town. She joined Gata Daku MPC in 2007 and it has helped her ability to engage in business. She borrowed a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more 'nipa' leaves to be use for weaving. She plans to save a portion of her income for the future needs of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more 'nipa' leaves

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa is 22 years of age, married with three children. She has a small garden where she grows green peppers, tomatoes, and cabbages that she can sell within her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Epenesa needs a loan to buy more vegetable seeds, a wheelbarrow and fertilizer, garden fencing, garden tools, plastic bags, and a mist blower. She is a new member of SPBD. Epenesa will use the profits from her sales to expand her business and help out with her family's finances.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, gallons of chemicals, plastic bags, planting tools, a mist blower, garden fencing, and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es: Aracely de 51 años de edad  vive en casa alquilada con sus dos hijos, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, golosinas, entre otros, tiene 12  años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Aracely is 51 years old and lives in a rented house with her two children. She has a store where she sells basic necessities such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, candy, and other items. She has 10 years with her business, and that has given her sales experience that allows her to obtain better profits. 

Her store is located in her home and is very well-known by the people who live in the area. She has acquired a large clientele as she has the store well- stocked. She wants to see her business grow, and carry out a new investment, but needs working capital. That is why she is applying for a loan that will allow her to buy what she needs for the store. 

She says that she will pay off the debt, and at the same time is confident that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy beans, milk, eggs, bread, candy, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es: Blanca de 59 años de edad se dedica a la venta de medicina natural su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela porque sus productos son de muy buena calidad, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su esposo, blanca está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar más medicina por mayor y así surtir aun mas su negocio para tener una mejor calidad de vida con su esposo.
texts.en:
Blanca is 59 years old and sells natural medicine. Her business is located in the market near her home. She has a large clientele because her products are very good quality. With the earnings she gets she manages to cover some of her household costs. 

She lives in her own home with her husband. Blanca is requesting a loan that will enable her to buy more medicine at wholesale and supply her store even more, so that she and her husband can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more medicine at wholesale.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
As a parent of four children, Merlita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from poultry raising. Merlita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, noodles, etc.

loans.name: José Aguedo

texts.es:
José tiene 46 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es una persona humilde y trabajadora que se dedica a cultivar maíz, frijol y sorgo aprendió esta labor desde muy pequeño con su padre; ya que es el mayor de sus hermanos;  recuerda que su padre le compro una Cuma para llevarlo y enseñarle a limpiar la milpa madrugando y trabajando todo el día no tenia oportunidad de estudiar hasta que cumplió 14 años lo enviaron a la escuela y aprendió a leer y a escribir. Luego que decidió formar su propia familia se ha dedicado a cultivar granos básicos y a engordar cerdos criollos para ir subsistiendo y así cubrir otras necesidades. Ahora en día él enseña a su hijo a cultivar para que en el futuro puedan desarrollar habilidades de trabajo y le da espacio para que estudie y desarrolle otras habilidades.


Compra sus insumos en un lugar que le dan mejor precio y productos de calidad que él necesita, para su cultivo que es desde la semilla, fertilizantes, y venenos para control de plagas y enfermedades de sus cultivos; así plantar una buena milpa y obtener una buena producción en la cosecha. Y tiene que viajar en pick-up una distancia de 15 kilómetros para llegar hasta el lugar donde el cliente encuentra los productos que necesita.
