El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 12 sacos de sulfato, y sorgo para la siembra, también se va a comprar productos como fungicida, insecticidas para control de plagas y enfermedades; herbicidas para el control de malezas del cultivo. Además se utilizara una parte del dinero para pagar a personas que le ayudan a realizar el trabajo de preparación de terreno, siembra y fertilización de los cultivos plantados.

Con la inversión, se estará apoyando al cliente a que pueda comprar los insumos agrícolas, y así tenga la oportunidad de cultivar los granos básicos para el consumo de su familia. Y así el podrá dedicarse a sus cultivos que es lo que desde niño realiza, y es una forma de generar ingresos a su familia; ya que en el año pasado tuvo inconvenientes en su cosecha, por falta de asistencia, debido a que no disponía de dinero para hacerlo y que gracias al apoyo que hoy le brinda fundación campo, podrá sembrar sus granos básicos y dar la asistencia necesaria para obtener una mejor producción y el alimento de su familia como también un ingreso para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos y esposa.

 
Él piensa en que después de pagar este crédito, sacar otro y destinarlo a comprar ganado (novillas) para desarrollarlas dejarlas que se carguen y luego venderlas y poder generar de esta manera mas ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
José is 46 years old and married with two children.  He is a modest, hardworking person who is engaged in the cultivation of corn, beans, and sorghum.  He learned this work at an early age from his father.  Since he is the eldest of his brothers, he recalls that his father bought him a “cuma’ [curved knife] to carry and taught him how to clear the cornfield. Rising early and working all day, he didn’t have the opportunity to study until he was fourteen years old and they sent him to school where he learned to read and write.  Later, he decided to start his own family and has been cultivating basic grains and fattening Creole pigs to make a living and pay for other necessities. Nowadays, he is teaching his son how to cultivate so that he can develop job skills in the future and give him space to study and develop other skills.

He purchases his supplies at a place that gives him better prices and the quality products that he needs for growing such as seeds, fertilizer, and poisons to control pests and diseases in his crops.  In this way, he can plant a good cornfield and yield good production at the harvest.  In addition, he has to travel 15 kilometers in his “pick-up” to get to the place where his customers find the products they need.

He will use the loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo to purchase twelve bags of sulfate, and sorghum for planting.  He will also buy products such as fungicides, insecticides to control pests and diseases, and herbicides for weed control in crops. In addition, he will use a portion of the funds to pay people that help him with land preparation, sowing, and fertilizing planted crops.

This investment will help the client purchase agricultural inputs and so, cultivate basic grains for his family’s consumption.  He will also be able to dedicate himself to his crops as he has done since childhood, and in this way, generate income for his family.  Last year, he had problems with his harvest because he didn’t have money to take care of his crops.  However, thanks to the support that Fundación Campo is offering him today, he will be able to sow his basic grains and give them the necessary attention to obtain a better production. In this way, he will have food for his family as well as income to pay for the needs of his wife and children.

He thinks that after paying off this loan, he will take out another one and allocate it to purchase cattle (heifers), fatten them up and have them impregnated, and later sell them. In this way, he will be able to generate more income to pay for his household needs.

loans.use: to purchase sulfate, sorghum, fungicides, insecticides, herbicides, and pay laborers.

loans.name: Malaeolema

texts.en:
Malaeolema is a 66-year-old married woman with 11 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu,and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Malaeolema has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, a backpack sprayer, a shovel, bush-knives and fertilizer  for her plantation. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Malaeolema hopes to upgrade her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, a backpack sprayer, a shovel, bush knives and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur runs a service-based business providing motorcycle transportation in the community of Taguitic, Lanao del Norte. He is 51 years old, married with four children. Aside from the services, he also works on his rice farm, for it is their main source of income. He joined Gata Daku MPC in 2008 and it has helped him to improve his  situation and develop into being a better entrepreneur.

 He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit in order to repair his existing motorcycle to be used for the business. He hopes to improve the family's general living conditions in the near future.

loans.use: to repair existing motorcycle

loans.name: Nomi

texts.en:
Nomi is 44 years old and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, noodles, soap, groceries, etc.

Nomi has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Nomi aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, noodles, soap, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Yolanda De Jesus

texts.es: Yolanda de 35 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, todo con el único deseo de salir adelante y de esta manera brindarle una vida mejor a su familia. Yolanda vive junto a su esposo y sus dos  hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de verduras,  la cual está ubicada en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia, su esposo le ayuda con el negocio. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar hortalizas, tomates, papas, cebollas,  entre otros ya que de esta manera ella podrá vender más, lo cual es su prioridad, ya que de esta manera podrá darle una vida mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 35, is a very hardworking person who puts her all into her business wishing only to get ahead and provide the best for her family this way.  Yolanda lives with her husband and two children in a house of her own.  She sells vegetables in a market located near her place of residence; her husband helps her with the business.

She’s asking for a loan to be able to buy vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions, among others  because she’ll be able to sell more this way and this is her priority because this is how she’ll be able to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Kamalita

texts.en:
Maria Kamalita is a 42-year-old married woman with three children. She is a good seamstress and wants to turn her hobby into an enterprise where she could earn extra money to take care of her family. This was the reason for her to join SPBD in order to gain financial assistance. She plans to use the money to purchase a new sewing machine, rolls of fabric, thread, needles, oil, etc. 

Maria plans to reinvest some of her profits into her sewing business and use the rest to take care of her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine, rolls of cotton material, thread, needles, oil, and scissors

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Agustina works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from boarding house rentals and raising pigs. Agustina is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional tailoring materials like a sewing machine, cloth, needles, thread, etc. for her tailoring  business.

Agustina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional tailoring materials like a sewing machine, cloth, needles, thread, etc.

loans.name: Delmis Marina

texts.es:
La señora Delmis   de 41  años de edad,   tiene 02  hijos   que dependan  de ella, vive con su esposo en su casa propia,  ubicada en una comunidad de la zona sur de Honduras.
Doña Delmis se dedica desde hace 12  años al negocio de venta de pan de todas las clases  y  sus clientes son los amigos, vecinos, escuelas, pulperías y personas que comercializan con este producto.
Doña Delmis  sale junto con su esposo en su carro a vender por los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo y lugares aledaños, es una mujer trabajadora y con deseos de superarse.
Doña Delmis  está solicitando el préstamo para  la reparación de su vehículo desea comprar una llanta, aceite, etc.  con el apoyo del préstamo mandara a reparar el carro donde transporta el pan a los diferentes lugares.
Doña Delmis  está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma,  su sueño es mejorar su negocio y comprarse otro carro.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2013.
texts.en:
Delmis, 41, has two children who are dependent on her.  She lives with her husband in her own house located in a community in southern Honduras.  Delmis has worked for the last 12 years selling all kinds of bread; her customers are her friends, neighbors, schools, grocery stores and people who sell this product.

Delmis and her husband head out in their car to sell in neighborhoods and zones of San Lorenzo and surrounding areas; she’s a hardworking woman who very much wants to improve.  

She’s asking for this loan to repair her vehicle; she wants to buy a tire, oil, etc.  With support from the loan she’ll send her car that she uses to transport bread to various places to be repaired.

Delmis is very happy to continue with Prisma.  Her dream is to improve her business and to buy another car.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July, 2013.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle and to buy spare parts for it.

loans.name: Rudy Manuel

texts.es: Don Rudy es originario del municipio San Juan del rio coco en Esteli. Se dedica a la reparacion de zapatos. El esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCredito ya que su primer credito fue de mucho beneficio, logro mejorar su hogar y darle un techo digno a su familia. Solicita este nuevo credito para comprar materia prima tales como: pegamento suela de zapatos, cuero e hilo para cocer zapatos. Su meta futuro es lograr convertirse en un empresario en el oficio de zapateria.
texts.en:
Rudy is from the municipality of San Juan del Río Coco in Estelí.  He works repairing shoes.  He’s grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito because his first loan did him much good; he succeeded in improving his home and providing a proper roof for his family.

He requests this new loan to buy raw materials like glue, shoe soles, leather and thread to sew shoes.  His future goal is to become a businessman in the shoe store business.

loans.use: to buy soles, glue, leather and thread.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 35 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Aida is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other vegetable-farming supplies.

Aida has been farming vegetables for 9 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other vegetable-farming supplies

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 56 años de edad, es casado y es padre de 4 hijos. Desde muy joven se dedico a la agricultura junto a su padre y sus hermanos, con mucho esfuerzo su padre lo envió a estudiar y logro sacar un bachillerato, pero por la condición económica no pudo seguir en el estudio, a sus 25 años se caso y empezó a trabajar por su cuenta y con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo pudo darle el estudio a sus hijos.

 la compra de insumos agrícolas las realiza en una comunidad que esta a  4 kilómetros de su vivienda; luego tiene que pagar un medio de transporte para que se lo traslade a su casa; posteriormente tiene que pagar un carretero para que se lo lleve al lugar de trabajo a 2 kilómetros ya que solo por ese medio puede trasladarlo por lo escabroso de lugar.

El préstamo sera utilizado para la compra de insumos agrícolas, fertilizantes, abonos, entre otros y para la preparación de la tierra. Con el préstamo mejorara y favorecerá el cultivo de maíz. Con la mayor producción se tendrá unos mejores ingresos para su familia.

Para un futuro desea, terminar de darle el estudio a sus hijos mas pequeños.
texts.en:
Oscar, 56, is married and father of four children.  He started working in agriculture while still very young alongside his father and brothers.  With much effort his father sent him to school and he succeeded in graduating high-school but due to their economic situation was unable to continue any further.  At the age of 25 he got married and started working on his own and with much effort and work was able to provide schooling for his children.

He buys his agricultural supplies in a community that’s four kilometers away from his house so he has to pay a means of transport to bring him home and then has to pay a cart driver to take him to his place of work which is two kilometers away since this is the only means of transportation due to the rough terrain.

The loan will be used to buy agricultural supplies, fertilizer and manure, among others and to prepare the soil.  His corn crop will be improved and favored by the loan and with the larger crop yield he’ll have higher income for his family.  In future, he’d like to finish providing schooling for his youngest children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to prepare the soil.

loans.name: Evelio

texts.es: Evelio, tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposa, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en el municipio de San Francisco de Yojoa. Tiene 15 años de experiencia en agricultura. Cultiva maíz, frijoles, yuca y también cría de cerdos. Desde hace 3 años tiene cultivo de yuca en un área de 4 manzanas de tierra que renta actualmente. La producción la vende en el mercado local.  El préstamo que Evelio solicito es por L.10,000 el cual lo utilizara para la compra de cerdos y para abonar y fertilizar su terreno donde hace la siembra de yuca. Con esta inversión va mejorar la producción y asistirá a su plantación con los insumos que necesitan. Su meta es cosechar producto de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Evelio, age 35, lives with his wife, and he has four children.  He lives in the San Francisco de Yojoa municipality.  He has 15 years of experience in agriculture.  He grows corn, beans, and yucca, and he also raises pigs.

He has been growing yucca in an area that is four ‘manzanas’ [a manzana is 7000 square meters] for three years.  He currently rents the land.  He sells the production at the local market.

The loan that Evelio requested is for 10,000 lempiras to buy pigs and to fertilize the land where he grows yucca.  With this investment he is going to improve his production and take care of his crops with the supplies that he needs.  His goal is to harvest a better quality product.

loans.use: to buy pigs and to fertilize the land where he grows yucca.

loans.name: Lea Lucia

texts.es: Lea de 64 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su madre, hija y nieta, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en la que vende productos perecederos como refrescos, golosinas, dulce y otras serie de artículos comestibles y no comestibles; a través de  este comercio ha sacado adelante a su familia. Ella busca mejorar su calidad  de  vida,  por lo que solicita un crédito para incrementar la variedad de sus  artículos en su tienda, como: granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, etc. lo que le permitiría incrementar las ganancias de  su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en: Lea, 64, lives at a house she owns with her mother, daughter and granddaughter, she has a small store where she sells perishable products like sodas, snacks, candy and other food and non-food items; through this business she has gotten her family ahead.  She is looking to improve her quality of life, for which she requests a loan to have a larger variety of products at her store such as basic grains, sodas, snacks, etc. which would allow her to have more business income and improve the life conditions of her family group.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sodas, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Telmis Maria

texts.es: Telmis, tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera su pareja vive en el extranjero, tiene una hija y vive en el municipio de Victoria, Yoro con ella y su suegro. Desde hace 12 años que Telmis se dedica a realizar trabajos de confección de ropa. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y ofrece los servicios de confección de vestidos, blusas, pantalones, faldas y otros que le solicitan sus clientes. El préstamo que solicito es por la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras, con el cual va  comprar telas para la confección  de pantalones y vestidos que le han pedido. Su sueño es que su negocio prospere para poder ayudar con los estudios a su hija y poder hacer su casa.
texts.en:
Telmis is 33 years old. She is single as her partner lives abroad. She has a daughter and lives in the municipality of Victoria, Yoro, with her daughter and her father-in-law. 

Telmis has worked as a dressmaker for 12 years. She has her business in her home and offers dressmaking services for dresses, tops, trousers, skirts, and other things her customers order. 

She is applying for a loan of 15,000 Lempiras, with which she is going to buy fabric to make trousers and dresses that have been ordered. Her dream is that her business prospers so she can help pay for daughter's schooling and build her house.

loans.use: to buy materials for making trousers and dresses that have been ordered.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for  educational fees, sustenance, transportation, and books.

loans.name: Jose Ovidio

texts.es: José de 39 años de edad se dedica a la carpintería desde hace 12 años elabora  muebles, roperos, gabeteros, etc. tiene buena clientela por que realiza un buen trabajo y de muy buena calidad, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su familia, José esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar los materiales necesarios como madera, barniz, clavos, pegamentos, etc. que le permitiría incrementar las ganancias de  su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en: José is 39 years old and has worked in carpentry for the past 12 years. He makes furniture, wardrobes, chests of drawers, etc. He has a good clientele because he does high-quality, good work. With the profits he makes from his sales he can afford some of his household expenses. He lives with his family in a house that he owns. José is requesting a loan so he can purchase the supplies he needs such as wood, varnish, nails, adhesives, etc. This will allow him to increase the proceeds from his business and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase wood, varnish, nails, adhesives, etc.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.en:
Miguel Angel is a Kubo Financiero client and this is his story:

I am Miguel Angel and I am married with two children. I live in Mexico City, in a neighborhood called Nezahualcoyotl. I work as a taxi driver, I work everyday from 7:00am to 8:30pm in my taxi. I have been doing this for 2 years already. I have 10 recurring clients and also work in a taxi service company.

I will use this credit to fix the brakes, engine and change the tires of my car.  I am hoping to offer a better service for my clients by improving my vehicle's state. My biggest accomplishments are giving my children an education, maintaining my family and making improvements in my home. I am responsible person who likes to make payments on time.

loans.use: to fix the brakes, engine and change tires of my taxi.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia es una mujer de 28 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en una casa construida a base de adobe. Virginia tiene una tienda de productos comestibles que puso en el primer piso de su vivienda hace 4 años con la intención de ayudar a su esposo en el sustento de su economía familiar. Inicialmente compró poca mercadería para probar y luego viendo los buenos resultados que obtenia adquirió muchos más productos. Comenta que los productos que tienen mayor demanda son el arroz, azúcar, leche, avena y otros cereales. Para obtener ingresos adicionales realiza la venta de créditos para celulares así como frutas de la zona. Se siente muy a gusto con su trabajo porque también le ayudó a convertirse en una vecina muy conocida y tener muchas amistades aunque en ocasiones tiene clientes que le piden algunos productos al crédito y tardan demasiado en pagarle ocasionándole algunas pérdidas. Con el tiempo desea mejorar aún más su negocio y llegar a ser una comerciante mayorista para así mejorar sus ingresos y también su economía. Este es su tercer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para salir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para abastecer su negocio con productos como huevos, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y verduras.
texts.en: Virginia is a 28-year-old woman. She's married and has two children with whom she lives in an adobe house. Virginia owns a grocery store which she set up on the ground floor of her house. She set it up four years ago with the goal of helping her husband support their family's finances. At first she bought very little merchandise to give it a try, and soon she saw the good results she was getting and bought much more products. She reports that the products that are in highest demand are rice, sugar, milk, oats and other cereals. She also sells cell phone recharges as well as fruits from that area in order to obtain additional profits. She feels very comfortable with her work because it also helped her to become a very well-known neighbor and make several friends. However, occasionaly there are customers who ask for merchandise on credit and take too long to pay her, resulting in some losses for her. In time she wishes to improve her business even more and eventually become a wholesale seller, so that she can improve her profits and also her finances. This is her third Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she's receiving so she can get ahead. In addition, she pledges to make her repayments in a timely fashion. On this occasion she wishes to get 3,000 nuevos soles in order to stock her business with products such as eggs, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs such as eggs, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story:

I am Irma, I am 43 years old. I only finished middle school and then left school to begin working. I  have been married for 18 years,  I live with my husband and we have 5 children, but only 3 of them live with us. I sell shoes, cosmetics and underwear from several brands. I have been in this business for 10 years.

I will use this loan to purchase footwear goods that I sell door to door by catalog. By having a larger inventory of products, I will be able to better serve my clients and increase sales.  I consider myself a responsible person because I cover all of my personal expenses and I am also able to contribute in paying household expenses and improving my home.

loans.use: to invest in shoes that I sell door to door with a catalog.

loans.name: Maricel Gay

texts.en:
Maricel Gay is a 26-year-old entrepreneur who is single and lives in Pagadian City. She owns and operates a service-based business providing motor transportation and rental to make a living. She has been in this business for years. 

In 2012, she joined Gata Daku MPC and gained access to the microfinance services of the cooperative. She borrowed a loan of 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to acquire a motorcycle to be used for the business. She hopes to improve the business and her general living conditions as well.

loans.use: to acquire a motorcycle.

loans.name: Cristelita

texts.en:
Cristelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Cristelita has been in this business for 20 years. Cristelita earns more income from raising pigs.

Cristelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Arcena

texts.en:
Arcena is 25 years old with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Arcena has a buying and selling of rice business in the Philippines. Arcena requested a 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Arcena has been in this business for four years. In the future, Arcena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena works hard to support her family. Elena is married and has a blacksmith business in the Philippines. Elena has been in this business for 20 years now.

Elena requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like steel bar,wood, etc.

In the future, Elena would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like steel bar, wood, etc.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 37 years old and she is married. She has five children. 

Juliana has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan, and she is applying for her second loan of $1,000. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Sagiko), hard drinks, beer, water, noodles, coffee, sugar, salts, eggs, body lotion and biscuits. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) because it offers loans to poor people. Her husband is a teacher.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Sagiko), hard drinks, beer, water, noodles, coffee, sugar, salts, eggs, body lotion and biscuits.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 48 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos. Procede de una familia numerosa de 8 hermanos y de muy bajos recursos económicos, se dedicaban a la agricultura y le ayudaba a su madre en la cocina y algunas ventas que hacia su madre, mientras su padre y sus hermanos trabajaban en la agricultura.

A sus 25 años se acompaño y procreo dos hijos, pero esta relación no le funciono y tuvo que dedicarse a crecer a sus dos hijos por su propia cuenta, tenia que hacer ventas para mantenerlos y llevar la comida a su casa, luego empezó a ayudarle a su tía a la compra y posterior comercialización de semilla de marañón. Después de algún tiempo empezó a trabajar por su cuenta y con poco capital luego con el tiempo y con ayuda de créditos ya trabajo un poco mas.

 compra la semilla de marañón en diferentes lugares, donde esta es producida en los lugares mas cercanos; pero en algunas ocasiones, cuando es escasa tiene que trasladarse a lugares mas retirados donde esta es producida; luego tiene que pagar un medio de trasporte para su vivienda. Cuando las tiene en casa,  tiene que asarlas para que esta pueda ser comercializada posteriormente.

El préstamo sera utilizado para la compra y posteriormente comercialización de semilla de marañón. Con la inversión, lograra comprar mas semillas de marañón y tendrá mayor numero de clientes. Rosa Manifiesta que en un futuro piensa ampliarle mas a su pequeña casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 48-year-old woman and has two children. She comes from a big, very low-income family with eight siblings. They worked in farming. She used to help her mother in the kitchen and in a few sales her mother made, while her father and her siblings worked in farming.

At the age of 25, she began living with a partner and had two children, but this relationship didn't work out and she had to raise her two children on her own. She had to make sales in order to support them and put food on the table. Soon she started helping her aunt to buy and then sell cashews. After a while she started working on her own with a little capital. Soon, gradually and with the help of loans, she already had a little more work.

She buys the cashews in different places where they're produced. She buys them at the closest locations, but sometimes when they're scarce she needs to travel to more distant places where they're produced, and then she has to pay for transportation to her house. When she has them at home, she has to roast them so they can be sold later on.

The loan will be used to purchase cashews for selling later on. With this investment she'll succeed in buying more cashews and she'll have more customers. Rosa reports that she thinks of enlarging her small house someday.

loans.use: to purchase cashews for selling later on.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia lives in Pasingcalan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur, with her family. She is 48 years old with an only child. She owns and manags a farm, planting and harvesting corn to earn a living. Farming is their main source of income. 

She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC microcredit to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She joined GDMPC in 2007. She hopes to gain more harvest for sale and be able to use it for farm expansion.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 34 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Elisa is borrowing 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elisa has been farming rice for 11 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport and farming coconuts and vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana de 61 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su hija, ella se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ana es una mujer increíble y muy ejemplar  ya que es muy trabajadora, responsable y positiva, además, muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su persona y de su trabajo. Elabora variedad de prendas de vestir  a precios muy accesibles. También ofrece calidad en su trabajo, razón por la cual muchas personas la prefieren. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para  invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: telas, hilos, elástico, botones, agujas,  etc. todo  esto lo hace con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a los clientes de tal forma que los clientes se sientan motivados a seguir solicitando sus servicios y así sus ventas e ingresos se vean incrementados. Espera lograr su objetivo y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 61 and lives in her own home with her daughter. She works as a seamstress, making and selling clothing in her home. Ana is an incredible woman and a model of integrity: hard working, responsible, and positive. Many people have provided strong personal and professional references for her. Ana makes a variety of high-quality garments that she sells at very reasonable prices. She has gained many loyal customers in her many years of experience and is always attracting new ones. 

Ana decided to apply for this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her small business by purchasing essential supplies such as fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, needles etc. These items will help Ana provide even better service to her customers so they'll continue to order clothes from her. Her sales and income will increase, allowing her to fulfill her ambition of achieving a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, needles etc.

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Emerenciana works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns income selling charcoal and farming rice.

The recipient of 17 previous loans from NWTF, since repaid, that have helped her sustain her business activities, Emerenciana is now borrowing PHP 27000 to purchase additional meat, vegetable, spices, etc. for her restaurant. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional meat, vegetable, spices, etc. for her business

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Genevieve works hard to support her family. She buys and sells rice in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming rice. Genevieve is borrowing PHP 26000 through NWTF to purchase additional rice to sell.

Genevieve has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice to sell

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is married with five children. She is 44 years old and lives in Pasingcalan, Ramon Magsaysay, Philippines. She helps her husband manage their rice farm, which is their main source of income. She joined Gata Daku MPC in 2007; she has now requested a loan of 4,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to cover the costs of fertilizer and weeding maintenance. She plans to cultivate more plots of rice and is hopeful that she will see her children successful in the near future.

loans.use: to cover the costs of fertilizer and weeding maintenance

loans.name: Hugo Antonio

texts.es:
Hugo tiene 29 años de edad, es casado y ha procreado un hijo. Se dedica a la agricultura desde hace muchos años, se desempeñaba como mozo; pero desde hace 8 años trabajo en lo propio. Aprendió de un tío y de su suegro dado que él es huérfano de  padres y hoy en en día trabaja junto a su hermano y su esposa. 

Camina 150 mts a pie  hasta llegar  donde aborda un autobús, para  llegar ala ciudad que esta a unos 18 km; luego aborda otro autobús en el cual viaja hasta otra ciudad,  donde compra los insumos(fungicida, fertilizantes ,insecticidas y otros) para su cultivo .

El crédito sera utilizado en la compra de fertilizantes, herbicidas y plaguicidas para su cultivo de maíz y pipían. Le dará un mejor beneficio a su cultivo del cual espera tener una producción abundante y suplir las necesidades de su familia 

Su primera proyección, es comprar un terreno para  construir su casa, donde planea vivir con su familia.
texts.en:
Hugo is 29 years old, married and has a son.  He has worked in agriculture for many years.  He used to work as a waiter but for 8 years he has worked for himself.  He learned from an uncle and from his father-in-law given that he is an orphan and nowadays he works together with his brother and his wife.  He walks 150 meters until he arrives at the place where he boards a bus in order to get to the city that is some 18 kilometers away.  Then he boards another bus on which he travels to another city where he purchases the supplies (fungicides, fertilizers, insecticides and other things) for his crops. 

The loan will be used in the purchase of fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides for his corn and pumpkin crops.  He will give better treatment to his crops from which he hopes to have an abundant production and meet the needs of his family.

His main goal is to buy land to build his house where he plans to live with his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides for his corn and pumpkin crops.

loans.name: Nelba

texts.es:
Nelba, de 24 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su pequeña hija en la casa de su abuela. Ella es una mujer trabajadora, a pesar de su corta edad tiene dos negocios que le brindan una estabilidad económica, además de ahorrar para el futuro de su pequeña hija. Su día comienza muy temprano cuando prepara sus instrumentos agrícolas y se dirige a los terrenos de cultivo de olluco, cebada y papa que comercializa constantemente, ya por la tarde dedica su tiempo a el cuidado de su tienda de productos comestibles que acondicionó en su casa desde hace 2 años aproximadamente, le gusta este negocio porque le permite pasar más tiempo con su menor hijo. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico recibido, además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.  
Nelba, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros.
texts.en: 24 year old Nelba is a modest woman. She lives with her small daughter in her grandmother's home. She is a hard-working woman. In spite of her young age she has two businesses that give her economic stability, in addition to saving for the future of her daughter. Her day begins very early when she prepares her farming instruments and goes to her fields of ulluco, barley and potato that she regularly sells. In the afternoon she tends to her grocery store that she put in her house approximately 2 years ago. She likes this business because it allows her to spend more time with her young child. This is her first loan with KIVA, for which she is thankful for the economic support, in addition she promises to be punctual with her loan payments. Nelba will invest the S/.2000 in buying basic needs products for her grocery store such as rice, sugar, milk, and other items.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, milk and other items.

loans.name: Hilda Guadalupe

texts.es: Hilda  de 48 años de edad vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo en casa propia ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, golosinas, refrescos, entre otros, tiene muchos 20 con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, como toda buena comerciante  quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. Hilda asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hilda, 48, lives with her 2 children and her husband in her own home.  She has a store where she sells basic consumer goods, beans, milk, eggs, bread, snacks, drinks, and other items.  She's had this business for 20 years, and this has given her sales experience that enables her to obtain better earnings.  Her business is located in her house, which is located in a very busy area.  She has many customers because her store is well stocked.  

Like all good merchants, Hilda wants to grow her business and make a new investment.  However, she lacks the capital to do this.  This is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can buy staple foods, snacks, eggs, bread, drinks, etc.  Hilda is certain that she will pay off the debt, and she is also confident that this will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy staple foods, snacks, eggs, bread, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Cherilyn

texts.en:
Cherilyn is 46 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. She is engaged in direct sales of Natasha, MSE, Avon products, motor and car tires and other accessories on a lay-away basis. She earns approximately 20,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stock of goods for her sales business. 

Cherilyn has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. In the future, Cherilyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of goods

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gloria has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.

Gloria is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional feed to sell. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed to sell.

loans.name: Soama

texts.en:
Soama is 42 years old and is married with 4 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu, bananas, and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Soama needs a loan to buy chemicals, bushknives, files, a wheelbarrow, and barbed wire for her plantation. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. Soama will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bushknives, files, a wheelbarrow, and barbed wire.

loans.name: Marielyn

texts.en: Marielyn is married with two children. She lives in Sinara Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Her husband works as a driver and she has a catering business to earn a living. Marielyn offers a cook-to-order service in her community. In 2011, she joined Gata Daku MPC and recently requested a loan to buy raw ingredients for her business. She plans to build a shelter for her catering business and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for her catering business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 57 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married but is separated from her husband with whom she has 4 children. 

Helen is engaged in hog fattening activities and earns approximately PHP5,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing sacks of feed for her existing hog fattening business. 

Helen has been a member of PMPC for almost 1 year. In the future, Helen hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing sacks of feed.

loans.name: G.s Los Amigos Group

texts.es:
El señor Mario de  41  años de edad es soltero, no tiene  hijos  que dependen de él, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 08  años  a la venta de abarrotería.
Don Mario en su negocio vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar, sus clientes el prefieren por su buena atención y por la calidad de su producto.
Don Mario es líder del grupo, le llamaron así debido a que está formado por amigos, se llevan bien como vecinos y son solidarios los unos de los otros, son un ejemplo de grupo llevan varios prestamos trabajando juntos y su misión es progresar.
Don Mario está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de abarrotería como ser: pastas, jabón, pollo, embutidos, leche, café, azúcar, frijoles, arroz,  etc. está muy contento por al apoyo de Prisma  a su grupo solidario y espera que con las ganancias que obtengan de sus negocios mejore un poco su calidad de vida.
Doña Valentina su negocio es una pulpería que tiene más de 3 años.
Don Santos su negocio es la venta de leña de desde hace 10 años.
Don Mario su sueño es mejorar su negocio y también desea que sus demás compañeros prosperen, se muestran las fotos de ellos con cada quien con su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2013.
texts.en: Mario 40 years old, single and does not have any dependent children. He lives in the San Lorenzo community, in southern Honduras. He has his own house, and for the past eight years, he has been working in groceries sales. Mario sells everything related to family needs. His customers appreciate his service and product quality. He is the leader of the “Los Amigos” [The Friends] solidarity group. It is called The Friends because the group is made up of friends and neighbors who get along and are supportive of each other. They are an example of a group that has been working together and their mission is to advance. Mario is requesting a loan to purchase inventory for his grocery store such as: pasta, soap, chicken, sausages, sauces, milk, cheese, rice, sugar, salt etc. He is very pleased with the support of PRISMA and profits they all earn from their businesses which are improving their quality of life.   Valentina has a grocery business for more than three years. Santos has been selling firewood for the last ten years. Mario’s dream is to improve his business and also wants his fellow group members to thrive, each of whom is pictured with their respective businesses. San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2013.

loans.use: to buy pasta, soap, chicken, sausages, milk, coffee, sugar, beans, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 34 years old and is married with five children who are in school. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell, like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc. Jocelyn has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a photo lamination business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like wood, photo paper, etc. for her photo lamination business. Josephine has been in this business for 7 years. Josephine earns more income from raising pigs.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like wood, photo paper, etc.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 38 years old and is married with two children who are in school. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Jovelyn is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Jovelyn has been fattening pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Judy works hard to support her family. She has a welding shop business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Judy is borrowing 27,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional materials like a welding machine, steel bars, etc., for use in her welding shop business.

Judy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like a welding machine, steel bars, etc., for use in her welding shop

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Cliente vive en casa de un familiar él se dedica a la venta de peluches trabaja en las diferentes ferias que hay en el país, tiene mucha demanda por ser un producto muy vendible en las ferias, con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos que tiene en su casa, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más peluches por mayor y poder seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y seguir ayudando a su familia en los gastos de las casa sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: This client lives in a family home.  He makes a living by selling plush toys at the different festivals he works in his country. He has a large demand for such a marketable product at the festivals.  The profits that he earns will help with the house costs.  The client is asking for a loan to buy more wholesale plush toys, to be able to continue with his business since it's his only source of work, and to continue helping his family with the house costs without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale plush toys

loans.name: Frely

texts.en:
Frely, 31, is happily married and lives in Siaboc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental together with her two children. 

Frely operates a specialized retail store to earn a living. She has been in this business for many years and she earns 3,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional school supplies like notebooks, pads of papers, pens and other items.

In the future, Frely will use her income to support her two children in their studies until they finish college and also in their daily needs. Frely wishes that her business will grow.

loans.use: to purchase additional school supplies like notebooks, pads of papers, pens and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Albino

texts.en:
Albino is from Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 59 years old. Albino is married and has six children. Her wife is a teacher while Albino owns and operates a business providing transportation services to earn a living. Albino has worked in his business for more than 10 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2007, Albino joined GDMPC. Albino is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to acquire another motorcycle. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

loans.use: to acquire another motorcycle.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra es una joven madre que tiene 19 años, es soltera y su hijo de 2 años es la motivación para esforzarse cada día por un mejor estilo de vida, pues ella sueña poder tener su casa propia y vivir confortablemente allí con su pequeño. Sandra ha recibido la ayuda de los abuelos de su hijo y vive con ellos y su hijo en Quito, la ciudad capital de la República del Ecuador específicamente en el sector sur de la ciudad en donde el comercio es muy activo. 
Sandra con la guía de su madre aprendió desde muy niña el arte de la cocina, ella prepara unos exquisitos platos típicos y por supuesto también platos a la carta, hace dos años, con el nacimiento de su hijo, ella vio la necesidad de sacar provecho a esta habilidad en la cocina e instaló en un pequeño local un restaurante en donde ofrece desayunos, almuerzos y platos a la carta además de platos especiales como “pinchos”, “tripas asadas”, “encebollados de pescado”. Sandra decidió emprender con este negocio cuando después de buscar por mucho tiempo un trabajo que le sustente a ella y su hijo, encontró todas las puertas cerradas, pues solamente estudió la escuela primaria y esto no era suficiente en ningún lugar. 
Ahora Sandra aprovecha los conocimientos adquiridos con su madre y en la escuela para administrar su local de comida en donde ella personalmente se encarga de la preparación de la comida y el servicio al cliente. Invierte todos los días de martes a domingo al menos 6 horas y en su tiempo libre comparte con su hijo y también busca distraerse haciendo algunos trabajos de costura. 
Sandra solicita el préstamo para poder hacer arreglos en la infraestructura del restaurante, pues hacen falta algunos adornos e implementos que le den al lugar un ambiente en el cual sus clientes se puedan sentir a gusto y que además llamen la atención cuando las personas pasen por el lugar. Ella está segura que con este crédito sus clientes aumentarán y así sus utilidades serán mayores lo que le ayudará a cubrir los gastos del hogar y además a brindar a su hijo un estilo de vida de calidad.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 19-year-old young mother. She is single, and her 2-year-old son is the motivation to make an effort every day for a better lifestyle, since she dreams of being able to have her own house and live comfortably there with her little one. Sandra has received the help of her son's grandparents and lives with them and her son in Quito, the capital city of the Republic of Ecuador, specifically in the southern sector of the city where business is very active.

Sandra, with her mother as her guide, learned the art of cooking from the time she was very young. She makes some delicious typical dishes and, of course, dishes a la carte. Two years ago, with the birth of her son, she saw the need to take advantage of this skill in the kitchen, and she started a restaurant in a small building. She offers breakfast, lunch, and dishes a la carte as well as special dishes such as "pinchos" (kebabs), "tripos asadas" (grilled tripe), and "encebollados de pescado" (a soup made with onion and tuna). Sandra decided to start this business when, after looking for a long time for work that would sustain her and her son, she found all the doors closed, since she only studied through primary school and that was not sufficient anywhere.

Now Sandra takes advantage of the knowledge acquired from her mother and at school to manage her restaurant, where she personally takes charge of the food preparation and the customer service. She invests at least 6 hours every day from Tuesday through Sunday. She shares her free time with her son and also looks to amuse herself by doing some sewing work.

Sandra is asking for the loan in order to be able to make repairs to the restaurant's infrastructure, since it needs some decorations and implements that would give the place an ambience in which her customers could feel comfortable and that would also draw attention when people pass by. She is sure that with this loan her customers will increase and therefore her profits will be greater, which will help her to cover the household expenses and also to give her son a quality lifestyle.

loans.use: to make repairs to her restaurant

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: María, tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en el municipio de San Francisco, Atlántida. Ella siempre ha sido comerciante, lleva 6 años vendiendo ropa como blusas, pantalones, camisetas, faldas, short, etc. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante y en su casa. Ha mantenido esta actividad mediante la inversión de varios préstamos con ODEF. Actualmente ha solicitado el quinto préstamo que es por 25,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar más mercadería de ropa variada para la venta. Su plan es mejorar su negocio para que sus hijos puedan estudiar.
texts.en: María is 43 years old, a single mother, has four children and lives in the San Francisco, Atlántida neighborhood.  She has always been a merchant; she has been selling clothing such as blouses, pants, t-shirts, skirts, shorts, etc. for 6 years. She sells door to door and from her home. She has maintained this business through various loans from ODEF. Today she seeks her fifth loan for 25,000 Lempiras, which will be used to buy a variety of clothing to sell. Her plan is to improve her business so that her children can attend school.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 69 años, está casada con Carlos 68 años, él es jubilado y recibe su respectiva mensualidad del gobierno con la que se ayuda para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Ellos tuvieron 8 hijos cada uno de los cuales lleva una vida independiente. Ella sueña con poder terminar su casa que aún está en proceso de construcción.  María vive con su esposo en Los Bancos un cantón de la Provincia de Pichincha, una de las provincias  más grandes en la República del Ecuador. Este cantón se encuentra a pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Quito, posee varios atractivos turísticos como cascadas, ríos, senderos, balnearios en donde el turista es atraído por los deportes de aventura que se venden allí con seguridad garantizada. 
María al ver la necesidad en su hogar, decidió aportar para el gasto de la casa desde hace 10 años, pues emprendió ubicando en medio de una calle concurrida un puesto de comida en donde vende plátanos y choclos asados, un producto muy demandado por las personas que transitan por esta calle, que servido con “mapahuira” (grasa que brota de sofreír el cerdo), representa un delicioso aperitivo para las tardes. Ella dedica hasta 11 horas cada día en su negocio pues debe comprar lo necesario en el mercado, preparar la “mapahuira” y llevar todos los implementos hacia su puesto de trabajo el cual al estar a la intemperie provoca pérdidas los días que el clima no está en sus mejores condiciones.  María realiza su primer crédito en Fundación Alternativa el cual lo invertirá en hacer varios arreglos a su puesto de comida para protegerlo de los cambios climáticos y además dar más confort  a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María is a 69-year-old woman who is married to Carlos, age 68. Her husband is retired and receives a monthly pension from the government, which helps to sustain their household. They have eight children and each one lives independently. María dreams of finishing her house, which is in the process of construction. She and her husband live in Los Bancos, a canton within Pichincha Province, which is one of the largest provinces in the Republic of Ecuador. This canton is located a few kilometers from the city of Quito, which has several tourist attractions such as waterfalls, rivers, trails, and spas. Another attraction is the adventures sports in which tourists can participate with guaranteed safety.

Seeing the needs of her family, María decided to help with the household expenses 10 years ago. She established her food stall in the middle of a busy street where she sells bananas and roasted corn, products that are in great demand among the people who pass by. María also sells “mapahuira” (the pieces of fat that are rendered after frying pork), which is a popular afternoon snack. She works 11 hours each day at her business, which enables her to buy what she needs at the market for preparing “mapahuira”. María must also carry her implements to her food stall because she does want them to deteriorate on the days when the weather does not provide the best conditions.

She is receiving her first loan from Fundación Alternativa. The money will be invested in various repairs to her food stand so that she can be protected whenever the weather changes. In addition, she will be able to make her customers more comfortable.

loans.use: to make physical improvements to her food stall.

loans.name: Paz

texts.es: Paz de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella posee una tortillería la cual es muy conocida en la localidad donde  reside, tiene muchos clientes pues vende  las mejores tortillas, calientitas y con el servicio más rápido además a precios realmente accesibles; paz es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de  salir adelante, tiene una actitud de  ganadora, por eso siempre se mantiene delante de  la competencia, ella piensa que cuando alguien desea algo debe saber que corre riesgos y por eso la vida vale la pena, quiere correr el riesgo para poder hacer crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor. Paz tiene la esperanza que de  esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena para su familia.
texts.en: Paz, 59 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and her two children. She has a tortilla shop which is very well-known in the town where she lives. She has many customers because she sells the best tortillas, nice and hot, with the fastest service and at really accessible prices. Paz is an entrepreneurial woman with a desire to move ahead. She has the attitude of a winner, and for this reason she always stays ahead of the competition. She thinks that when somebody wants something they should know that they are taking a risk and that's why life is worth it. She wants to take the risk in order to be able to make her business grow. That is why she is asking Integral for a loan that will let her buy wholesale corn. Paz hopes that this way she will be able to bring economic security to her home and a full life to her family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn

loans.name: Irma Patricia

texts.es: Irma de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y  sus dos hijos de 8 y 5  años de edad, es una mujer  muy responsable y trabajadora, ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan, refrescos, aceites, verduras, frutas, golosinas y también de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo entre otras cosas tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación. Irma  solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en:
Irma, 32 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and their two children, ages 8 and 5 years.  She is a very responsible and hardworking woman and has been able to get her family ahead.  

She has a store with groceries such as bread, soft drinks, oils, vegetables, fruits, snacks and also basic needs such as:  soap and shampoo, among other things.  She has her business in the house where she lives.  

Irma is applying for a loan through which she will be able to stock her store even more, so that she can better serve her customers and in this way, improve her sales, which is her priority for moving her home forward.

loans.use: to buy bread, soft drinks, oils, vegetables, fruits, snacks, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 46 years old and is single. 

To make a living, Arlyn provides Internet services in the local community. Arlyn has been engaged in his business for years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities. He also owns and manages a general store to gain an additional income.

In 2007, Arlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Arlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase a printer to improve his Internet services. 

Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase rice and corn grits, feed, and other farm supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits, feed, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Aracely Beatriz

texts.es: Aracely de 29 años de edad es madre soltera vive en csa propia con su hijo, ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza desde hace 2 años en su lugar de residencia trabaja de 9:00 am a 7:00 pm tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Aracely  solicita un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, tintes para el cabello, espejos, secadoras, planchas para el cabello, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su hijo.
texts.en: Aracely, 29 years old, is a single mother. She lives in her own house with her son. She has had a beauty salon for 2 years in her residence. She works from 9:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. She has many customers because she does very good work. With her earnings, she is able to cover the expenses of her home. Aracely is asking for a loan in order to be able to buy products for her beauty salon such as creams, shampoo, hair pins, scissors, hair dye, mirrors, dryers, and irons, among other items she needs. In this way, she will be able to obtain better earnings that will help her and her son to have better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo, hair pins, scissors, hair dye, mirrors, dryers, irons, etc.

loans.name: Emerson

texts.es:
Emerson es un joven de 21 años de edad, trabaja como operario de construcción desde hace ya un años y con lo cual apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar. Desde muy pequeño tuvo la necesidad de trabajar ya que sus padres no tenían muchos recursos económicos y es por ello que solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Civil.

Emerson está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales para poder construir un pequeño cuarto en su vivienda, ya que será para su pequeña hermana, que actualmente el cuarto donde se encuentra es de esteras, de esta manera podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguirá esforzándose y luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Estudiar una carrera universitaria y poder tener una casa de material noble”.
texts.en:
Emerson is a 21 year old man. He has worked as an equipment operator in construction for some years. That is how he helps his parents with the household expenses. Since he was very young he has needed to work, since his parents didn't have a lot of financial resources. That is why he was only able to go to school up to the fifth year of secondary school, but he would have liked to study civil engineering. 

Emerson is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to buy materials to be able to build a little room in his house which will be for his little sister. Right now, the room she is in is made of rushes. This way he can improve his family's quality of life. He will keep striving and fighting to make his biggest dream come true: going to college and being able to have a brick house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Elizardo

texts.en: Elizardo is a farmer who operates his own farm, planting and harvesting corn to earn a living. He is happily married with two children and lives in Pasingcalan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. He is an industrious entrepreneur that, even when crisis comes, is confident enough to meet the needs of the family. He borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC to cover the costs of farm weeding maintenance. He hopes to see his children become successful in the near future.

loans.use: to cover the costs of farm weeding maintenance.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 33 years of age and lives in Happy Valley Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is married with three children.
Roselyn sells fresh fish to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns 1,500 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to pay for a stock of fresh fish.
Roselyn has been a member of Paglaum MPC for almost five years. In the future, Roselyn hopes to earn more and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay for a stock of fresh fish

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Julieta works hard to support her family.

She buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and frozen food sales. Julieta is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her charcoal business, general store and frozen food sales business.

Julieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Posee mucha experiencia en la siembra de maíz, frijol y sorgo. Aprendió el oficio de su abuelo, ya que fue él se dedico a crecerlo. Tiene aproximadamente 15 años de dedicarse a la agricultura. También en tiempos que no se da la siembra, trabaja como barrendero en el mercado de la ciudad. Viaja aproximadamente siete km desde su casa hasta la cuidad, donde compra los  insumos que va a utilizar para la siembra.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación campo, es para comprar abono, herbicidas, pesticidas para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz; ya que no tiene dinero para comprarlos. Y con los ingresos que obtenga utilizarlos para su manutención y la de su familia.

Don Miguel espera, seguir trabajando para crecer a sus hijos y que no les falte nada. También, quiere darle la oportunidad a sus hijos de estudiar cosa que el nunca tubo. Y en cuanto al trabajo espera  en un futuro duplicar la cantidad ahora siembra.
texts.en:
Miguel is 41 years old, married and has three children.  He has a lot of experience in sowing corn, beans and sorgham.  He learned the profession from his grandfather, who raised him.  He has made living in farming for approximately 15 years.  He also works as a street sweeper in the city market during non-sowing times.  He travels approximately 7 kilometers from his house to the city, where he buys the supplies he will use for sowing.

The loan that he is asking for from Fundación Campo is to buy fertilizer, weed-killer and pesticides to sow 7,000 squared metres of corn since he doesn't have the money to buy them. He will utilize the profits he earns to support himself and his family. 

Don Miguel hopes to continue working to raise his children so that they don't lack anything.  He also wants to give his children the opportunity that he never had to study something.  In terms of work, he hopes to double the amount that he sows now in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weed-killer and pesticides to sow 7,000 squared metres of corn since he doesn't have the money to buy them

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 63 años de edad, es casada y actualmente vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Yolanda se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos de granja, además tiene como otros ingresos la siembra y cosecha de maiz. Lleva en está actividad un promedio de 5 años al principio le fue complicado ya que no contaba con los ingresos suficientes pero con el pasar del tiempo su negocio se hizo bastante rentable, además este negocio le permite estar en su casa junto a su familia. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
El dinero solicitado de S/2500.00 lo invertirá en la compra de pollos al por mayor para su negocio.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 63 years old. She is married and right now lives with her 2 children in her own home. Yolanda buys and sells farm chickens. She also has other income from planting and harvesting corn. She has been doing this activity for about 5 years. At the beginning it was complicated since she didn't have enough income. But over time her business became very profitable. In addition, this business allows her to be in her home with her family. This is her first Kiva loan and she is grateful for the support she is receiving to keep going forward. She is also committed to making her payments on time. 

The S/2500.00 she has asked for will be invested in buying chickens wholesale for her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens wholesale.

loans.name: Veronie

texts.en: Veronie lives in Sinara Bajo, Jimenez Misamis Occidental with her family. She is a student getting her BS in Aquatic Resource at Mindanao University of Science and Technology (MUST). She continues her studies with the help of her parents and, during her free time, works part time to earn an income. She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC to cover the costs of her tuition. She is hopeful that she will find success in the near future.

loans.use: to cover the cost of school tuition

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica a la venta de ropa, lociones, cremas para el cabello, desodorantes, cadenas, pulseras y anillos de enchape lo hace de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ogra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo, su hija y una sobrina, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor y así poder surtir su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad.
texts.en: This borrower has a business selling clothing, lotions, hair creams, deodorants, and plated chains, bracelets, and rings.  She sells from place to place in the various markets that are close to her home.  With the earnings she obtains from her sales, she is able to cover some of the household expenses.  She lives in her own home with her husband, daughter, and a niece.  She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise at wholesale so that she can stock up her business.  This way, she can obtain better earnings and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lotions, hair creams, deodorants, and plated chains, bracelets, and rings

loans.name: Rosa Vilma

texts.es: Rosa de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta y elaboración de hamacas vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la buena calidad de sus productos, Rosa esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de  tela, hilos de polipropileno, algodón, nylon, etc. para seguir elaborando sus hamacas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Rosa is 48 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. For several years she has been making and selling hammocks. She is a mobile vendor throughout the different neighbourhoods that are close to her residence. She has many customers because of the good quality of her products.

Rosa is seeking a loan for the purchase of fabric, polypropylene thread, cotton, nylon, etc., in order to continuing making her hammocks since this is her only source of work. In this way she will have a higher income to give her family all that they need.

loans.use: to buy fabric, polypropylene thread, cotton, nylon, etc.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 37-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has four sons and three daughters. Her two sons are doing jobs as motor mechanics on daily wages. The condition of her house is not good, and the living standard of her family is miserable.

Saima requested a loan of 35,000 Pakistani rupees for her husband. Her husband owns a spare parts shop in which he sells motorbike spare parts such as silencers, fuel tanks, foot rests, wheels, tires, tubes, etc. Her husband also supplies spare parts to other shopkeepers with his rickshaw. Nowadays, his auto rickshaw is out of order due to overloading. Its engine needs some maintenance. Through this loan, her husband can easily fix the problem with his auto rickshaw. Saima hopes that one day the miserable condition of her family will change.

Saima is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: José Avilio

texts.es:
José tiene 44 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos. Es una persona que se ha dedicado a ser agricultor desde que tenia aproximadamente10 años, ya que sus padres no poseían los recursos necesarios para brindarle el estudio, tuvo que aprender el trabajo. Él recuerda, cuando su padre una persona que fue agricultor toda su vida,  lo llevaba al terreno donde tenían la milpa para que le ayudara a trabajar, y así fue como aprendió a conocer cuales son los cuidados y las labores que se le realizan al cultivo de maíz. José,  es un agricultor con mucha experiencia, trabajador y sobre todo una persona honesta y con deseos de superación.

 Vive aproximadamente a cuatro km de distancia de la carretera litoral. Por lo cual hace un gran esfuerzo cuando le toca salir a comprar los insumos que necesita para el cultivo, puesto que le toca que caminar esa distancia, ya que no existe transporte fijo en la comunidad donde vive. De ahí, viaja en bus hasta la ciudad a comprar todo lo que utilizara para la siembra. Y tiene que hacer el mismo recorrido hasta su casa, ya esta vez le toca que pagar un carro para que pueda llevarlo, ya que no podría con la carga de todos los insumos.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar semilla, fertilizantes, herbicidas para control de malezas y plaguicidas para controlar de manera preventiva el ataque de plagas y sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. 


La inversión, le ayudara grandemente, debido a que cultivara y tendrá para consumo personal y de su familia y con  el resto espera obtener ingresos con la venta de maíz y así cancelar el préstamo y a la vez seguir teniendo la puerta abierta de futuros prestamos en la fundación. 


Él tiene pensado si Dios le presta vida, seguir con la siembra de maíz. Pero quisiera  sembrar en mayores cantidades de terreno, con lo que tiene pensado en un futuro poder optar a nuevos prestamos para comprar 7,000 metros cuadrados de terreno.
texts.en:
José is 44 years old, married, and has 4 children. He has been farming since he was 10 years old, as his parents didn't have the necessary resources to provide him an education, he had to learn how to work. He remembers, when his father who was a farmer all his life, would take him to the field where he was planting so that José could help him work, and in this way he learned which where his chores and tasks to do to grow the corn. José is a very experienced, hard-working, and above all honest person with desires to succeed.

He lives approximately 4 km from the coastal highway. So it takes a great effort when he has to go buy the items he needs to farm, as he has to walk this distance as there isn't regular transportation in the community where he lives. From there, he travels by bus to the city to buy everything he needs to plant.
